Reviews.Title: “Hotel Italia, Rome”
Reviews.Author: AmaliaNovianti
Reviews.Content: The location is very good only 10 minutes walk from Termini station, or about 5 minutes walk from the nearest metro station. The bus stop is also only few steps away. And by walking around 10-15 minutes you will reach the main attraction in Rome, such as Colloseum, Fountain di Trevi, etc. So it is guaranteed that you will not find difficulties to explore the city on foot or by public transportation. The staff is absolutely very nice from the beginning. I think they are the best serving hotel staffs along my travel in Europe. All things that I need they will respond very quickly. The reception is available 24 hours. The room and bathroom are clean and neat and they will make it up everyday also. Absolutely will stay there again if I go to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean budget hotel with friendly helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: TJ O
Reviews.Content: After the initial surprise of climbing some flights of stairs to locate the hotel,we were booked in promptly and settled in.We found the management and staff very friendly and helpful and we were always made to feel welcome.The rooms were immaculately clean and everything was always in order.The hotel was very well situated and was only a short walk from all the sights.The breakfast was fresh and adequate and continental.But the friendly greeting every time we returned to the hotel would always encourage a weary traveler to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Staymagical
Reviews.Content: A relative had stayed here and recommended the Italia to us. We were not disappointed, the staff were very professional, friendly and very helpful. The breakfast was a decent continental, the room was comfortable and clean. There was a laptop available to guests in reception, handy for checking emails and googling local restaurants etc.The Hotel is a short walk from Termini Station and is ideally located for walking to all of the main tourist attractions. We didn't use any local transport during our stay and our 4 days was over too quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Travels_without_fuss
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a university study tour and were not disappointed. This hotel is not lavish - but it doesn't sell itself as such. I think for a 2 star hotel it pushes far above it's weight. The staff are very friendly and the night staff at the desk are very helpful in suggesting good night spots. The hotel is located right near the Termini and as Rome is walking friendly city, it is possible to travel very far on foot from this hotel. We also enjoyed the lovely restaurants in the district! Our room was a reasonable size and the beds were quite comfortable. The rooms have quite a large wardrobe and therefore it is possible to hang up many items and there is also quite a large desk. The bathrooms were a reasonable size with just a small shower. The breakfast was an adequate continental breakfast and tea and coffee requests were quickly attended to. I very much appreciated the warmth of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Long Weekend Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ksherm5
Reviews.Content: Hotel Italia was recommended to me by a friend who is a frequent solo female traveler. It did not disappoint. The price was comparable to other area hotels. It was a close walk to Termini for arrival and departure which was convienent. We were graciously allowed early check-in which was nice and unexpected. The room was very clean and good sized. The heat worked very well...maybe too well for someone who doesn't like to be "toasty". Wifi worked well. The outer door locked at night and we had to be buzzed in, which was a good security measure. The staff was very helpful. We spoke no Italian and yet they were so accommodating...making recommendations, giving directions, even teaching us handy Italian words, without us ever feeling like we were bothering them. There were lots of food and shopping in the immediate area. It was very nice to be greeted in the evenings by Abdul at the front desk who inquired about our day. The complimentary breakfast was good...tasty cappuccino...typical European breakfast fare. The location could not have been better. The Roman Metro is not very extensive at all and fortunately we were able to walk everywhere we wanted, from the Colosseum to the Pantheon to all the major piazzas. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “First timer”
Reviews.Author: Jackie P
Reviews.Content: Hotel did accomodate many languages and it was freshly painted. Also breakfast was ok. the room was SOOOooo small and NO Wi-Fi as promised. the shower leaked all over the floor and hallway always smelled like fried food. The location was convenient

Reviews.Title: “A Great Home Base in Rome”
Reviews.Author: DeweySue
Reviews.Content: This hotel was our start and end to our trip to Italy. We found the staff both friendly and helpful during our time at Hotel Italia. I was personally impressed by the multilingual staff and found every question answered. The rooms were comfortable and clean. A short distance from a grocery (across the street) and a reasonable walk to pretty much everywhere in Rome. We walked to Vatican City, the Spanish Steps, the Colosseum, the Pantheon and many other major sites even the Galleria Borghese! The best feature is the relatively short walk to the train station. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Mary R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over Christmas and found it to be a very enjoyable stay. The rooms were comfortable and clean, the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the breakfast was good and it was convenient to the train station and the metro. We were backpacking so having the train station within walking distance was a plus. We will definitely stay here again and hope we can return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: endre b
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of their family rooms for a couple of nights last August (2011). We picked this Hotel mostly based on Rick Steeves’ travel guide recommendation, the good location and reasonable rates. However their impressive website fool you, it just doesn't match reality, at least not for the room they put us in. The furnishings and decor is not nearly as clean, spotless and maintained as it looks on their website. The bathroom was ridiculously tiny (for four), smelled mouldy and had a A/C drain pipe coming out of the ceiling, dripping directly into the shower stall. Because room service left the floor mat neatly folded on the shower threshold, it soaked up some of the A/C drain fluid and caused it to leak all over the bathroom floor. The staff was not particularly friendly and the breakfast was simply not worth sitting down for, (if you can find a table in a very cramped and noisy dining area during peak morning times) - nothing fresh, just pre-packaged foods, including the 'croissants'. In regards to the A/C charges, beware they will charge you as long as you have the remote in the room, even if you don’t actually use it. I made the wrong assumption they monitored A/C usage with their computer, as most hotels are able to control the A/C from the front desk. Even though we didn’t use it the first day, they insisted on charging me. It wasn’t so much the 10 EUR/ day, as the attitude I received from Sabrina which really annoyed me. We also had noisy neighbours above us, (kids jumping on beds it sounded like), and when I made enquiries at the front desk, they told me that the floor above does not belong to the hotel, and are private residences. The one good thing was the location in terms of nearby attractions, however the actual street (via Venezia) and building entrance was very unattractive, sooty and dirty. Overall not a great value. I emailed the manager after our return to tell him of our experience and he said he would try to address some of the issues I had raised.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay all around!”
Reviews.Author: GabrielRodriguez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Italia from December 26th, 2011 to January 1, 2012 and everything about our stay was excellent. The staff are friendly, helpful, and always available. They helped us with arrangements before we arrived and made reservations/recommendations for us and answered all of our questions while we were there. The room and bed were comfortable. The entire hotel was spotlessly clean. The breakfast very good. The coffee is some of the best we had during our visit to Rome. Hotel Italia is located right off of Via Nazionale and is located a few blocks from a Metro stop. It is within walking distance of everything from the Colosseum to Vatican City. Having the Metro stop nearby makes traveling to outside the city very easy. The neighborhood is safe relatively quiet (remember, this is a big city.) The cost of the hotel was a good value. All in all we were very happy with our stay. We will gladly stay there again and recommend them.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get”
Reviews.Author: Donna B
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised when we stayed at the Hotel Italia, in Rome, last evening. Having followed the advice given in earlier reviews on Tripadvisor, we asked for the family room in La Residenza. The staff were welcoming and helpful. The room itself was spotless. The beds were comfortable and there was plenty of space for our family of four to make ourselves comfortable. Breakfast, moreover, was comprised of fresh pastries and capaccinos on demand, and set us up nicely for a day of sightseeing. It is true that one could hear outside traffic, at night, but this is probably the trade-off for staying so centrally in Rome. Most attractions were within walking distance and, otherwise, the 64 bus took one almost directly, door to door, from the hotel to the Vatican (tip: you can buy your 1Euro bus tickets from the hotel reception on your way out the door). All in all, this hotel lived up to its reputation and is good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Location, spotless, accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Henry V V
Reviews.Content: This is a small boutique hotel located perfectly for walking to most of the historical sites. The rooms are small, but we spent little time in them anyway. (led a group of 18 persons) Very comfortable beds, very very clean. A small negative.......the corner showers are tiny! (Heaven help you if you drop the soap!) The included breakfast was more than adequate. The staff were friendly and helpful. Another small negative......the reception is on the second floor, and there is just a small cargo elevator. Quite a few steps. On balance, this hotel offered the essentials at a very good price. Would not hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit!”
Reviews.Author: dan t
Reviews.Content: Hotel owner is day clerk. Does anything you want and refused tip. Nice Continental breakfast. Location is wonderful! Don't be afraid to stay here. Very clean, well run Hotel. Just visited Rome, Florence, Venice, and Paris. Would certainly go back. Stayed a week in Hotel Italia...

Reviews.Title: “Average Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: avio
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in a small single room. The good include budget/affordable, clean & good location. The not good is the window opens up to an inner not so clean concrete court-yard with odors (as others have reported) from a restaurant cooking & what smells like sewer gas. Decided to keep windows close & ran the a/c instead, which cost extra. The a/c had a musty smell. Below average breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “An Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Lori S
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was a pleasant surprise: the staff were friendly and helpful, they provie a decent breakfast with protein sources, spacious single room (extremely clean, bright and cheery) with a desk. Compared to some of the other places in Italy, this hotel was the like a palace. Great location: near metro, colloseum, Trajar's Column & Forum and not too far from Trevi Fountain. Decent sized shower for a european hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful discovery: much better than 2 stars indicate”
Reviews.Author: MikTheViking
Reviews.Content: Thanks to tripadvisor critiques we chose this tremendous gem of a place! But where do we start singing its praises? First, the welcome: all reception staff are friendly, pleasant and hospitable. From the moment you press the bell for entry everything is smiles and helpfulness. And they are always at hand. True 24 hours service. Remarkable in this industry where the "bottom line" often dictates minimal services. So next, amenities: our room was bigger than expected, quiet, well appointed and clean. The bathroom was on the smaller side, but we were not cramped. The breakfast room doubles as a lounge, and as drinks are available 'round the clock, I suppose it can be called a bar as well. The breakfast spread had more choice than many a so-called four-star hotel. Service was quick and everything was fresh. Location: this hotel lies in a quiet side street off the Via Nazionale, itself a wonderful place for shopping. Everything the tourist could possibly need is within a 20 minute walk. Taxis and busses are only a few steps away. Overall impression: wonderful and affordable home-from-home with delightful staff. I cannot think of staying anywhere else on future trips to the Eternal City.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Dawn H
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel...It was amazing. Our room was perfect. The staff was pleasant and accommodating. Breakfast was yummy and more than anyone should eat! It was in a great location and we were able to walk to Colosseum, Metro & Termini, River Tiber, everywhere we wanted to go. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone. Anyone who has written a negative review must be very spoiled. I have stayed in 4 star hotels & I enjoyed this more, quaint, personable & location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Rome Hotel for those on a Budget”
Reviews.Author: bigcalculus
Reviews.Content: 1. Rooms are very, very clean 2. Hotel staff is very helpful/ they speak and understand English 3. Location of the Hotel is perfect. Its in the middle of everything. 4. Very affordable! That's important. Ask about the third floor option. The WIFI did not work well in our room, and the view was not exceptional...but for the price, this hotel was perfect for our Rome visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: ahottoddie
Reviews.Content: Very centrally located! Very accommodating staff! Thanks particularly to Abdul for helping with so many things too numerous to mention! A great value!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer77
Reviews.Content: Hotel Italia is a short walk from the main train station and convenient to ancient and classic sites. It's a short metro ride to the Vatican. The hotel is clean, comfortable, has a helpful staff and offiers a nice breakfast. Walls are thin. Bring earplugs and you will have a comfortable and pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, sufficient, and great location”
Reviews.Author: evabvictoria
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what I thought it would be. It is very clean, with good sized rooms, hot water showers with good water pressure, pleasant staff, and feels very safe. It is located right off of Via Nazionale, in close walking distance to the colosseum, in addition to many other attractions, (including the train station). The price is fair for Rome. If you stay on higher floors, the wifi is spotty, but on the main level it is excellent wifi. For the price, it is a great deal, a pleasant oasis for a landing pad between our Rome adventures.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Peter C
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 days in Rome on the front end of our trip and enjoyed our stay. Location is a 15 minute walk with luaggage from Termini and and a 15 euro taxi ride to tiburtina bus station. Short walk to Ancient Rome and most other sights. Rooms were good sized and clean with updated bathrooms. The entrie staff was excellent and fantastic to work with. Very knowledgable and helpful answering questions and meeting your day to day needs. Bus/metro tickets can be purchased at the desk along with restaurant suggestions. You can purchase wine/drinks next to the desk and enjoy in the breakfast area...which we took full advantage of.....without making you feel like you were imposing. Smaller grocery store located right up the street which offered great deli meets/cheese and wines. Would highly recommend this hotel for it's location, value and fantastic staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely breakfast room”
Reviews.Author: vivace_8
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Italy and arriving at the hotel around 1:00 am the night desk person was very helpful and friendly. Our room # 24 was clean with a roomy bathroom; comfortable beds and just enough room to move around in. The room was just steps from the ice machine (which sometimes was left unplugged by the cleaning staff) which was great since we filled up our own water bottles with ice every morning before heading out. The other two hotels we stayed in did not free access to an ice machine. Unfortunately the room was also right next to the storage closets for linen, etc. and every morning around 7:00ish the cleaning staff chatted and prepared for the day's load of room cleaning and changing supplies. The breakfast room was a real joy to go to - sunny and cozy - and the breakfast laid out was just what we needed to fuel up for a morning of wandering around. The hotel's location was also really central and within walking distance to many of the sights we were interested in. For the cost this hotel was really good - just ask for a room away from the supply / linen storage. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Italia is great!”
Reviews.Author: Linda K
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hotel Italia for nine days and had a wonderful time, also using the hotel as a base for a few day trips outside Rome. Everyone who works there is friendly and helpful and we really enjoyed interacting with the staff. Our room was very nice, clean and comfortable and the housekeeping staff did a great job. The hotel location is also very convenient with many major sites within walking distance and close to the train station. The reception staff could not have been more helpful in answering our many questions making recommendations to us and helping to arrange tours. A special thank you to Andrea, Abdul and Sabrina for all of their assistance. You helped to make our trip to Italy a most memorable one and we hope one day to see you again.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting hotel, very small room”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen311
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Italia for two nights. The hotel itself is very beautiful and we stayed at the annex across the street from the main hotel. Our room was so small that it was literally one step out of bed to the bathroom door.. probably the smallest hotel room we have ever stayed in. However, we spent our entire time in Rome walking around, so we didn't need a bigger room. And it was clean. The location was great: within a few blocks away from the Termini train station and within walking distance of many of Rome's beautiful sights. The area is safe and there are a few restaurants within walking distance. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. Breakfast was very good. One morning the main restaurant was full, so we were treated to breakfast upstairs in a small but sweet kitchen with beautiful linens and homemade pastries and fruit. We really enjoyed the smallness and local flavor of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ladydame
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my husband for 3 nights. The double room was clean but found the bathroom too small. And every time you take a bath, the water leaks all over the floor and outside the bathroom door. They should do something about that soon. Breakfast was okay with some salami, cheese, cereals, and bread. Coffee was good. And yes, you had to pay an extra EU10 for the aircon. The receptionist during our check-in was very nice. He gave us a list of places to go in Rome. But found the receptionist at check-out to be unhelpful and unfriendly, did not offer us any assistance for airport transfers or help with luggage. The hotel is in a very convenient location, near bus stop and metro station. The trattoria infront of hotel serves very good pizza and pasta. Overall, our stay was good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lancscitylover
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, Lovely staff very helpful. Great location of hotel , very central near to all major attractions except the Vatican, but hotel close to bus stop and its only a euro to the Vatican when bought from tourist information. Hotel a little dated but we would deffinatly recomend stayhing here. Bars and restaurants all close and well within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Slight Disappointment At the End”
Reviews.Author: cutiedoggy13
Reviews.Content: Good location as it was adjacent to Via Nazionale which was a main road and within 7 minutes walk to the Republica Metro Station. There was a Despar supermarket just across the Via Nazionale. Although the hotel was only 2-star, it was very clean and upon check-in, guests signed on electronic pad which was very modern. There was 24-hour free WiFi and breakfast was adequate with ham/salami/egg etc. Staff was generally very helpful especially with regard to information about sight-seeing and location of historical sites. The hotel was located only 20 minutes from Colosseum by foot and around 25-30 minutes from Spanish Square and Trevi Fountain. The receptionist Sabrina was very helpful. On the negative side, it was easy to miss the hotel as the hotel sign was on 1/F and you need to press the intercom for the reception to open the wooden door. Their single bed was very small and avoid the rooms near the ice machine was you can hear other guests getting ice as well as house keeping getting all their equipments in that area in the morning. Air conditioning comes at €10 extra and it was optional whether guests wanted to pay for it or not. The elevator in this old building was somewhat old and it was out of order during the final 2 days of my stay. On the day of my departure, although the senior guy at the reception was kind enough to take my luggage down as the porter only started work at 9 a.m., he dragged my suitcase by the handle along the marble steps. I was lucky the wheels of the suitcase were not knocked off but the handle of my suitcase was damaged and got stuck. Another small negative point was that if you want breakfast before their official starting time of 7 a.m., it was not possible. Also the young guy who served as night shift receptionist was not helpful as he avoided any promise/commitment to help when being asked whether there would be any porters helping with delivery of luggage the next day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: K_E_AUS
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mum & sister for 4 nights. We had a triple room in the main building which was really clean & tidy. My mum usually stays in fancier hotels so I think it was a nice surprise for her to stay in such a great little hotel for such a good price, that was very clean & safe. The breakfast was fantastic & the service from all staff was wonderful. The only negatives were that the wifi didn't work very well in the room & you had to pay extra for air con (necessary in August!), but neither of these things would stop us from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Under rated, we loved it and will certainly be back”
Reviews.Author: steffie228982
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband visited Rome for 7 nights in August. We chose this hotel through trip advisor and I am glad to say that we have no regrets at all. We had a double room on the 1st floor in the main hotel building. The room was spacious enough with a quite large bathroom and was extremely clean. We had a good abundant breakfast every morning. The staff was superb especially Sabrina and Abdul who gave extremely good and friendly advise when needed. The hotel is in an excellent location making it very easy to walk around to most of the popular sightseeing places, or even by bus or metro. Since hotel was in a very central location it was very easy for us to go out in the evening without any worries. Place was very safe to walk around. We would like to thank all the staff from the receptionist to the very sweet lady who greeted us every morning for breakfast for the excellent service they gave us and for treating the guests as friends. Thank you once again xxxxx from Stefania and Alfred

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, helpful staff - a good basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caroline E
Reviews.Content: My daughters and I stayed in a triple room in the main hotel building. The reception area is on the first floor accessed by a small rather creaky lift! However, once inside the room was small but clean and perfectly good for a stay of two nights when most of the time we were out sight-seeing. Our room had a small window which opened out to an internal space which made paying the additional 10euros for air conditioning a real necessity (but the hotel made this extra charge very clear before booking.) There was free internet access and a breakfast included in the price which represented good value for money. Hotel Italia is exactly what you would expect for the price (probably better) - I would definitely stay there again as it was in a good location to be able to walk to many of the major attractions and all of the staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Should be 3 Stars”
Reviews.Author: MattyPaula
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were met by Abdul who is one of the nicest, most friendly people i have ever met. He helped us organise what we would see during our stay, book tours for us and even helped us perfect some italian words and phrases. The rooms were clean and had plenty of space for a couple. We did not spend much time in the room as we spent as much time outside seeing rome. Breakfast every morning was great and we ate our filll of cereal, bread and coffee. Overall we had a fantastic time and really want to thank all the staff at this hotel. I am a bit confused why it is only 2 stars as the quality of rooms, service and location are excellent. Well done to all the staff in particular to Abdul who made our stay a very happy one.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean and great location.”
Reviews.Author: tybeegirlOhio
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms, 2 doubles, 1 single. The rooms are very small with limited room for bags and moving around. The showers are also very small. We stayed across the street from the main lobby so had to cross over in the morning for breakfast. Breakfast was very nice with a good selection. The elevator is 10 Euro cents to use. The a/c was 10 extra Euros per day per room, but, well worth it for us as it was VERY hot (95-100 F) while we were there. The a/c is also very efficient. The bed was very comfortable but a regular double bed, not queen. The room and bath were clean. The staff are extremely helpful and speak English well. There is a bar on the same side of the street as the hotel lobby, attached to a restaurant. We did not eat at the restaurant but the bar was great! Good location, 10 minute walk to the metro. 1 minute walk to a main street with restaurants and shopping and busses. Hotel personnel can help with tickets for most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “OK but I'll go elsewhere next time”
Reviews.Author: TonyInLondon
Reviews.Content: I can see why lots of people might give this place great reviews but I'd like to sound a note of caution. It's true that the front desk staff are great & the hotel is clean. But I saw some shortcomings as well - though to be fair, they probably grated because I was there for 8 nights & also because I didn’t get one of the better rooms. The window from my room opened into a well - down the bottom of which was the kitchen of a restaurant. To avoid sleeping in a miasma of garlic it was necessary to shut the windows of an evening. The bathroom has been fitted into a tiny space so that some gymnastic ability was required to gain entry to the shower. On a related topic, the cleaners took a view that you got a cake of soap when you arrived & that was that - even if you were there for a week. Finally, I found breakfast a bit of a trial. Many of the rooms (including mine) are in a separate building across the road so one needs to walk down the stairs, cross the road & then up the stairs on the other side. Once in the dining room, there are way more rooms than tables, so the staff step in to arrange the sharing of tables. (OK maybe that's not a problem for you but I'm a misanthrope until my second cup of coffee!) Overall not bad, but I'll try elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Folks are Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Merv81
Reviews.Content: I stayed there my last night in Rome, so I was only there one night, but it was great. The front desk staff is very personable and helpful. They had a wonderful dinner suggestion which was just around the block from the hotel, so it was definitely convenient as well. My single room was very clean and the shower was one of the better ones throughout my weeklong trip throughout different Italian cities. I would definitely go back as the price is right too!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in downtown Rome”
Reviews.Author: JohnHung
Reviews.Content: Hotel room is clean, staff is nice, and I love its ample breakfast. The location is very convenient, close to Republica metro station and about 15 minute walk to Termini station (main train station) or Colosseum. Bus stop is at the corner and super market is across Via National. Highly recommend for budget traveler.

Reviews.Title: “I liked the Hotel Italia so very much!!”
Reviews.Author: Redbarbara
Reviews.Content: What sets this hotel apart is its Staff. They are knowledgeable, helpful and friendly. Every single one of them! I traveled with my 18 year old niece and felt perfectly secure in their facility. Rooms were on the small side but clean and comfortable. In fact the whole place was nice and clean. The location is good - within walking distance of many of the big Roma attractions with bus lines very close by. Also an easy walk to/from the train station. And, despite being right off a very busy street, it was quiet in the room at night. If I ever make it to Rome again, I will most definitely return to the Hotel Italia.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and staff-a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: beckym1313
Reviews.Content: After staying at another hotel nearby we were very pleased with the warmth of the staff in comparison. They were VERY helpful when we had difficulty with using our ATM. They paid as much attention to us (American tourists) as they did italian speaking tourists (our first hotel in Rome ignored us). The beds were very comfortable; bathroom spacious in comparison; awesome breakfast and coffee. Quick to give directions and any requested advice. If ever in Rome again we would most definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, nice people, great room”
Reviews.Author: jackiesr
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in Rome before, over around Piazza Navona (more expensive places in the center of things. This times, I wanted to be closer to the Termini train station and Roman forum: we were coming in by train and leaving by train. The Hotel Italia is about 5-6 blocks from the station, not too close and not far enough that you cannot roll your luggage down the street easily. Right off of Nacionale and Via Venezia, About a 10 minute walk south to the Colliseum and Roman Forum. We hopped on bus 64 (also a couple of others) to get east over to Trastavere and Piazza Navona area. The cost was around 90 euros, Rome isn't cheap to stay in. 2 star hotel, nice large rooms. Breakfast with the room--good variation of rolls, cheeses, meats, yogurt, cereal, fruit. We had also stayed in the St.. Moritz, right on Nacionale right around the block from Italia. This was a better place, bigger room. HOWEVER, I should mention that they charge for air conditioning (10 euros per day). Kind of a surprise, although it 'mentioned' this on my confirmation. ou HAVE to have AC in Rome, if only for the quiet of closing your windows at night. Anyway, the helpfullness of the staff plus the size of the room compensated for extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: JiraMonkey
Reviews.Content: We liked the location of this hotel. The rooms were basic but clean. One of our rooms had a bad (sewer) smell the whole time that did not go away. The breakfast was adequate but nothing special. I would consider booking one of the renovated "Residenza" rooms in the future, but otherwise i wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Title: “good in general”
Reviews.Author: luckyMontreal_Canada
Reviews.Content: hello pros: the situation in the center of rome, the staff is helpful, cleaness cons: our room smell the drains sometimes but my friend room was ok . wi-fi didn't work all the time in our room we felt confortable, the breakfast was one of the best in our italian tour( yogurt, juice, bread, egg, ham, pasticerie) and I am sure that if I've talked with the staff they had change us from our room. anyway the drain smell wasn't often.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Italia”
Reviews.Author: kathykar
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, excellent location, short walk to Republica Stazione metro station and bus stop end of the street. Rooms were small as you would expect and bathrooms small but very clean. Beds comfortable. Breakfast was very good and only one fault noted was no breakfast served for hotel guests who are booked on tours with early pick up. Great little restaurant called Trattoria Pizzeria "Al Venezia" which was moderately priced and served some great home made tasting dishes is directly opposite the hotel, a must try for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Jackrew
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. Very pleased with the level of service and cleanliness of the hotel. Rooms are good size (no. 24 was anyway, some are smaller). Breakfast is good and staff are so friendly. Location is very convenient, just off main shopping street. We walked to all the sights everyday! Rooms were cleaned, beds made and fresh towels every day. Hot water in a good shower (small but good). I did a lot of research on price and location and I would definatley recommend this hotel as a good base. Enjoy Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetc16
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend in May and this was definitely one of the nicest hotels we stayed in during our stay in Italy. We were in the Residenza, which is on a separate floor and had a separate room upstairs for breakfast. It was like having breakfast with family as we all sat at one table that seated 6 people. I was so amazed with the size of the bathroom as we had a full bathtub and that was the first time we saw that in Italy. Our room was red and white which I thought was appropriate since we are from Canada. The staff was so friendly and helpful and we really appreciated all their assistance. Thank you for such a wonderful experience and I will be back to stay there again whenever I get back to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: dabbytoo
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay close to Termini as I always do. Finding something that doesn't suffer from traffic or noise can be difficult. The Hotel Italia is a good choice. I had a single room that was very small but very clean. My biggest disappointment was the window looked out on a dark courtyard (of sorts). All of which to say, I received virtually no sunlight. Most of the staff was very helpful although a couple "not so much". the breakfast didn't rise to the level of other Rome hotels at which I stayed. In addition to WiFi, the hotel does have a PC in lobby for guest use. Very nice. AC is extra. I don't know if I agree with this but they are up-front about it. All in all, this is a safe and good choice. For the money, I might look around a bit before deciding.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel: very comfortable, excellent service, nice location”
Reviews.Author: Mechii
Reviews.Content: I've stayed twice in this hotel, in different types of rooms and I really loved it. People that work there are very nice and worm, willing to help if the guests need them. They have an excellent predisposition and speak several languages. Rooms and bathrooms are very tidy and clean. Beds are comfortable. There is free wifi access in every room. There is an ice machine available in each floor. Breakfast is very good, especially their cappuccinos and croissants. I would definitively return, I had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and Lovely”
Reviews.Author: cmorta
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I spent 3 nights at this lovely hotel. Rooms are a bit small, but not for European standards. The location was PERFECT. We walked to 90% of Rome's major attractions, and took the metro to the remainder (which couldn't have been easier). Also, it's blocks from Roma Termini, which means we didn't have to deal w/ transportation upon our arrival. The staff was extremely warm and helpful. The included breakfast was surprisingly quite good (some hot food), and was immensely convenient. I would recommend Hotel Italia to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Small Affordable Hotel in Heart of Roma”
Reviews.Author: apBoston
Reviews.Content: Having scanned many hotels, I feel exceedingly lucky to have booked at Hotel Italia, which is just off one of Rome's main streets, V. Nazionale, and yet quiet & civilized. It would be hard to find a friendlier, more efficient staff, or cleaner, more cheerful environment. The main desk is on the 2nd floor; the stairs did not bother me, &, if needed, there's an elevator. The hotel is 10 minute walk from the train station, which provides easy commute to airport. Best, it's close to a vibrant network of small restaurants and boutiques on the same side of Via Nazionale. (Visit via urbana & other streets). Hotel Italia is so central, you can easily walk all over Rome, as I did -- though it can take a while to get your bearings! Also, it's a block from one of Rome's best museums, Palazzo delle Esposizioni.

Reviews.Title: “Good surprise in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Carol_B_SP
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with hotel Italy, despite being a two star hotel, the service is great, the room was confortable and very clean and the breakfast was also above average. It has a decent location, close enough to Termini and a 15-20 min pleasant walk from the old center of Rome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A real find”
Reviews.Author: BristolOldtrout
Reviews.Content: We felt very lucky to find this hotel as we booked rather late in the day. It was really well-located. It was a short walk from Termini for buses and trains and there was a bus stop a few paces away - handy as the metro was on strike when we stayed. Our rooms were nicely appointed with spacious shower rooms and tea and coffee making facilities. If I have a bleat or two to make it was the aspect of our room (70) which looked out onto a small enclosed space directly over the kitchen vent of the 5-star hotel restaurant next door. We could tell what time of day it was from the cooking smells. Our hotel owners had thoughtfully provided an air-freshener which helped a bit. Also we did not have bedside lights and only one bedside table. Our daughters' room (66) looked over a different 'inner space', equally ugly to look at, but both of our rooms were incredibly quiet because of their aspects - no noisy traffic to disturb our very sound sleep. I think we had these rooms because of our late booking. I saw a number of other lovely rooms by nosing through open doors while the maids were preparing them for new guests. The rooms had Italian TV only showing Italian versions of all the tripe we get at home - e.g a ladette to lady programme, cookery, millionaire - so being able to speak Italian wasn't actually necessary to follw what was going on! The hotel occupies a few floors in a tall building with a lift. We were on the third floor which had its own little breakfast room (breakfast until 10am) where a maid looked after us each morning by making tea and lovely coffee. In addition we had a nice buffet to choose from - breads, pastries, cereal, tinned fruit, yoghurt, hard boiled eggs, omelette, sausage, many spreads, mayo and ketchup! We walked all over Rome and were pretty tired at the end of each day so we were pleased to find a little restarant immediately opposite the hotel door on the first night serving pizza and pasta amongst other things. Subsequently we ate at the reaonably priced Ristorante al Viminale (turn right then left from the hotel door) which seemed to be popular with the locals and served a variety of pasta and other dishes with lots of side veg dishes which we were really beginning to crave. The service was great and incredibly fast. We'd recommend the 20 Euro 48 hour bus ticket which was a hop on and off deal going all over the city. This was great for sightseeing when one of us couldn't walk any more. Rome traffic is heavy and very slow so we didn't mind relaxing on a slow tour bus taking it all in. The hotel also booked Vatican museum tickets for us online. This cut down on queuing but it was still a couple of hours shuffle with 100s of other people to get to see the Sistine Chapel. Queues for St Peter's Basilica were 2-3 hours long so avoid if possible or risk going later in the day. Take your own hairdrier if you need to blow dry. The ones in the bathrooms are white tubes without much puff. There is free internet access in the foyer - brilliant! We would thoroughly recommend this hotel for a city break. The staff are lovely and cannot do enough for you and you can just see how hard they work to make the Hotel Italia special.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dleigh7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a school trip to Italy. I had stayed at this hotel a few times before and we couldn't have asked for a better location. The rooms and amenities were just right and the staff was friendly and helpful. I always recommend Hotel Italia to friends traveling to Rome and will definitely stay there again in the future. Donna

Reviews.Title: “Great inexpensive stay”
Reviews.Author: NCR1030
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean, in a great location and the staff is phenomenal!! The only down side I saw was that the shower was very small but that's not unusual in Europe! The people who work in the hotel are so friendly and eager to help, we sat in the lobby just talking to the gentleman at the front desk one evening and absolutely enjoyed it! You're right off of via Nazionale and just 5 mins from Termini train station and 10 mins from the Colosseum so getting around is a breeze. They also have a laptop in the lobby that guests can use for free any time they like and a small but yummy breakfast selection. I highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay would go back”
Reviews.Author: dld77
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Hotel Italia and it was fabulous. The room (ask for the residenza suite) was just great! Clean, comfortable and room for the 4 of us. Great breakfast-loved the cappucino, and great location. Walking distance to most sites except maybe the Vatican and then we took the metro which was great. Sabrina was so nice and helpful as were the other staff. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: guilia73
Reviews.Content: What a delightful surprise the Italia was. We weren't expecting great things after a not so great hotel in Paris, and the Italia exceeded our expectations in every way. We stayed in a quadruple room in the main building. The room was large and impeccably clean. Our breakfast was served in a charming breakfast room right outside our room and the rolls were delicious. There was a lovely girl who served us awesome coffees and cappucinos. The best part of the hotel is without a doubt the staff. They were happy to assist with our every request, including storing our luggage while we left for an overnight stay along the coast and had them waiting for us in our room the next night. They offered great suggestions for visiting the attractions and avoiding the lines, as well as the fastest and easiest ways to get around. They could not have been kinder or more helpful. The location is great and convenient to the train station and all the attractions of Rome. A very sincere thank you to everyone at the Hotel Italia for providing us such a wonderful place to stay in Rome. We look forward to seeing them again, as this is the only hotel we would ever stay at when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Simple Hotel but walking distance from Historical Rome”
Reviews.Author: Laser_07
Reviews.Content: First impressions don't do justice to this hotel. Its a 2 star hotel but was anything but run down, cheap, dirty or anything you would think of such a small star hotel. It was some kind of surprise to me to find out that this hotel was 1 floor in a block or appartments, never saw something like that before! The staff is very helpful and know very good english. The hotel is very clean and small but very quiet (sometimes you would wonder if anyone lives in the other appartments!). The rooms are comfortable and may be a little smaller than average buit you have ensuite bathroom and TV. The bathroom is a little smallish in size but you will appreciate that the hotel has limited space. A very good thing about this hotel is that its not expensive and in the centre of historical Rome, literally walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Michael0919
Reviews.Content: The Italia is very simple and quaint. Rooms offer a/c and are very comfortable. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful to offer ideas for things to do in town.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: redAzleTX
Reviews.Content: stayed 3rd floor residenzia- newly re-done- nice rooms...great safe location. We could walk to all major sights- old and new Rome AND be within 3 blocks of Republicca metro to go Vatican. The staff was super helpful, they were even cheerful on Christmas Day which I know is a hard day to be working.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks again Hotel Italia!”
Reviews.Author: garrityc
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel last January with my family, and came back this year with girlfriends and a toddler for a long weekend. The hotel is a gem, nothing is too much for the friendly, professional staff, who are available to help with anything, good restaurant tips, a pot of tea late at night, or just a friendly chat in the reception. The hotel is spotlessly clean, the rooms are perfectly adequate with big bathrooms, and the hotel's position is very central. I would strongly recommend using the hotel's pick-up service to and from the airport, worth every penny. Grazie a Sabrina e a lo staff e alla prossima! C. De Giorgi, Geneva, CH

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scorpio51972
Reviews.Content: Just back after a weekend trip to Rome. Fantastic value hotel, very clean, friendly and central. Rooms small but clean. Free WiFi ...

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Italia is comfortable, charming & clean, a home-away-from home!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle29790
Reviews.Content: We always make it a practice to stay in smaller, family-run hotels in larger European cities. Otherwise, our preference is to stay at B & B's. This was our second trip to Rome. First time (4 years ago) was only 2 days. This time we stayed 6 days starting on 22 December at Hotel Italia in a quad room on the 3rd floor (where they have remodeled rooms that were formerly part of an apartment). The room was comfortable, very clean, with a large beautiful bathroom. We had a small little sitting room with table & chairs overlooking the courtyard area) which was curtained off from the sleeping area. This, alone, made us feel like home - but add to that the wonderful, helpful staff - and you really do want to stay there indefinitely! At the main desk there is Sabrina, who is so very personable and full of helpful suggestions and so very easy to talk to. She made dinner reservations for us on Christmas Eve and Christmas Day (along with Abdul - who also assisted in making reservations when Sabrina was off). The breakfast each morning was so lovely and delicious! We left to go to Sicily for 5 days and returned again to Hotel Italia for 2 more nights before returning home. This time we had a quad room on the main floor - which was just as lovely and clean. The bathroom was smaller, but was just fine for us. As everyone else has already mentioned, the location is perfect, the neighborhood is great with many wonderful places within walking distance to eat. Do be careful of pick-pockets in the subway station during rush hour. We had a very close call - we knew better, but were still feeling jet lag and not thinking straight. However, luckily I caught a women (holding a baby!) just as she was reaching for my husband's pocket. When it's crowded, always go to the first or last subway car - where it is less crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Hotel Italia”
Reviews.Author: TravelOn11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Italia for two nights. The bedroom was large and very comfortable. The bathroom was redone and very clean with good water pressure. Our room was on the inside of the building, not over the street, and therefore very quiet at night. Excellent staff helped with any questions and directions, arranged a ride to the airport for us, and even reminded us about the European Daylight Savings Time change to occur that evening (Thank you, Sabrina!) We were able to purchase our Metro tickets from the front desk, as well as a cold bottle of water (which saved us a walk to the market late in the evening). Good breakfast in their breakfast room staffed by a great waitress. Breakfast included a selection of breads, juice and good coffee and cappuccino. Good location near most of the major sights, and Metro stops were close enough if needed. We really liked this hotel as it was a good value for the money with a friendly and professional staff. If in Rome, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: italyfan25
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Rome and not our last. We stayed 10 nights in this charming hotel. The staff made us feel welcomed in this big City. They gave us excellent tips on where to eat and what to do on a rainy day and provided a map with directions to the sights. My husband and I walked every where in Rome the location is perfect and close to all the ancient sights. The breakfast buffet had a great selection of food, our tea was delivered by a very friendly server that made us feel welcomed each morning. It was sad to leave however since I threw coins into the Trevi we will return and we will again stay at the Hotel Italia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Roman Base”
Reviews.Author: iowanweber
Reviews.Content: Rome was our second stop on our honeymoon. We chose Hotel Italia because of it's close distance from the train station and it's price range. There is a bus stop near by for touring and resturants within walking distance. We were very happy with our stay. The staff was extremely helpful with advice and directions. The room was clean and the A/C (which is extra) worked well and quietly. This is a great hotel for sleeping and storing your luggage while exploring Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: attours
Reviews.Content: The location was great -- close to the train station but in the direction of the big sites (coliseum, the forum, ruins, etc). The room was a little more than other rooms on our trip throughout Europe but compared to other hotels in Rome this room was a good price. The included breakfast (cereal, rolls, pastries, yogurt, granola, fruit) in the lobby (very tasty) was also a big money saver and great start to our days. The air conditioning for the hot days and nights was also well worth any additional cost.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Italia Rescued Me!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinF00die
Reviews.Content: After a night in an awful hotel in Rome, I called Hotel Italia the next day desperately seeking a better place to stay. Not only did Hotel Italia have a room available for me that night at a wonderful rate, but Abdul, the gentleman who was working when I called, was so kind and helpful. Hotel Italia is in a great location, the rooms are so comfortable and clean and every staff member I encountered was as friendly as can be. Thanks to Hotel Italia, I was able to enjoy my last day in Rome. Grazie Mille!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: redpineapple
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the hotel, the bed was comfortable and the breakfast was plentiful. The staff was very accommodating and spoke English and could provide maps and dinner recommendations. Very clean and friendly. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel away from home”
Reviews.Author: Ciao49
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the hottest month in Rome, so we paid a little extra for the air-conditioning, and we were very comfortable in our rooms. The bathrooms are meticulously clean. The rooms are small, but that is to be expected in Europe. Our beds were very comfy, and we slept soundly. We had one room for the three of us, and another room for my daughter and her fiance. Their breakfast is outstanding with everything to choose from including eggs, wonderful soft cheese, breads/rolls, juice, etc.The hotel desk clerks were so kind, helpful, and patient as we practiced our Italian on them. They will provide you with maps, and answer clearly in English any tourist questions you have about the amazing sites in Rome. The location was a little bit of a walk from the train station, but I was so happy to see that the hotel was on a quiet street, and it had a good security entry. We highly recommend Hotel Italia, and I would return in a heartbeat if I could!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sunsnowandwater
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Italia in October 2010 with another couple on an extended city break. The hotel is well located in easy walking distance of many of the attractions and historic sights. For trips further afield the Metro is only a couple of minutes walk away. The hotel is well presented and spotlessly clean. All of the the staff are very friendly and incredibly helpful, nothing is too much trouble to ensure that you have the best possible stay. They are very willing to spend time explaining transport, advising on the best use of the discount cards, the best time to visit places, arrange taxis etc. The rooms could be considered a little on the small side but are well decorated with good beds and bathroom. Buffet breakfast offered a limited but plentiful amounts of fresh bread, rolls, croissants (sweet and plain), yogurt, cereals, cheeses, honey, jam, eggs, fruit juice tea and coffee. Small but limited bar, free wi-fi and a hotel laptop for your use in reception plus an array of travel guides, maps and tourist literature. Only downside we found was the street noise could be a little loud with the windows open. In summary great location, great staff - would use again when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay and will stay again if ever in Rome in the future!”
Reviews.Author: waynewilliams333
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at Hotel Italia Sabrina greeted us with kindness. That continued for our whole visit. (8 nights) The hotel is ultra clean, nicely decorated and newly renovated washrooms were a pleasant surprise. Being used to larger north american hotel rooms, the room size was a bit small to us but we adjusted quickly and it wasn`t an issue after a day or so. I`d recommend this hotel to anyone looking for clean safe friendly lodging at a reasonable price. If I had to pick a negative it was the noise from the street at night. This is not something that the hotel has any control of. The street cleaners are inconsiderate, they have little regard for the people trying to sleep at 2am. Not just their equipment but they`ll stand around and yack for ever. To Sabrina and the rest of the staff, thank you for making our stay an enjoyable and happy time. Wayne & Caroline Ottawa, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile”
Reviews.Author: olddogmusic
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at the Hotel Italia in Rome with our 3 children and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is not salubrious (ie it's plain) but what it lacks in style it certainly makes up for in friendliness and service. Abdul and the others behind the counter were always friendly and helpful with every request and helped us achieve the most from our visit to Rome. From recommended restaurants, to the lovely breakfast staff, recommendations of suitable sites for children and the provision of a lap top to use, due to ours being stolen in Florence, they were wonderful and no request was too much. Unfortunately we had to change our booking at the end of our stay to another hotel around the corner (Hotel Virgilia) due to a change in travel plans and were sorely disappointed, as the service there was appalling. The Hotel Itallia is our first choice next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected.”
Reviews.Author: AMF07
Reviews.Content: We were dissappointed in Hotel Italia on Via Venezia in Rome. I booked 2 rooms, and because they were booked under my name they only gave us 1 room with AC and the other we had to pay for. This was never mentioned on the website or when I booked it. We also had to stay across the street which did not make it convient for breakfast, or checking emails, or getting information. Lastly, when we had to stay across the street, there was a fee to ride the elevator, but not in the main hotel?? We were expected to pay for it without the hotel offering to reimburse you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: NMH72
Reviews.Content: Walking distance from Roma Termini. Very nice, clean rooms. The shower is very small (but that is the case in Europe), but very clean. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. Great breakfast with awesome coffee. Walking distance to many major sites. Also close to a subway station. Will stay here again for sure. We did have to pay extra for air conditioning which was needed very badly (we were just glad they even offered it).

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: littledat
Reviews.Content: We were extremely impressed and will most definitely stay there again if we come to Rome and will recommend your hotel to anyone we know travelling to Rome. Hotel was clean, comfortable and staff great your recommendations on eating and getting places was appreciated. Your staff did an excellent job cleaning our room, breakfast was delicious. Conveniently located. Close to metro, close to colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: montreality
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Italia for 4 nights. I chose this hotel based on researching recommendations on Trip Advisor, and we were not disappointed. I was able to get a great rate since I booked over two months in advance. The hotel is located in a busy area and close to Repubblica metro station. It's also about a ten minute walk (with luggage) from metro Termini, where the trains from Fiumicino airport can be taken (I second the warning about avoiding the south side of Termini station, pretty shady). The hotel is on a small street called Via Venezia, off Via Nazionale. To my understanding, it is split into two locations in opposite buildings on the same street, and we were staying in what I suppose was the main one. It is not so obvious from the outside, but just follow the sign into the residential-looking building and you'll find it one floor up. The room was spacious if not modern, however the bathroom was newly remodeled. Everything was cleaned very well each day, and the included breakfast was a great start to the morning before all those hours of walking :) The staff were all very courteous and helpful. We were given a great tip to book Vatican City online in order to save a lot of waiting time in line, and they were nice to print out the tickets too. The air conditioner is an option you can add on if you wish, and I believe it was 10 euros a day (don't quote me on this). However, the breeze from the bedroom and bathroom windows was enough for us and we didn't feel hot at all. The area is safe and has everything you need in terms of amenities. Even though we were close to a metro station, we still walked a lot of the times and it was nice that the hotel was in a central location (not far from Fontana di Trevi and the Capuchin Crypt, for example). If I ever return to Rome, I'll definitely consider staying at Hotel Italia again!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: b8ee
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great for the price. They have single rooms that are clean and comfortable. They are centrally located with easy access to Termini Station. I walked to and from during my two stays, it is less than ten minutes. Also, there is easy access to Metro and buses. The staff was extremely helpful, they offered internet access and information about buses and museums. Thanks to the helpful people at the front desk, I took a bus early to the Borghese Gallery and got in without a reservation. They also have guide books available to borrow, a good breakfast and helpful staff. Just a note, to those who ripped out the Rome pages in the guide books, this defeats the purpose and you are selfish. Also, there is an ice machine, something I never encountered again in my travels. I would recommend this hotel. Be careful around Termini though. Common sense and keeping your wallet in sight helps. Look at the map. I got ripped off by a cab driver the first day. You don't need a cab, you can walk easily from Termini. This hotel is a great place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay just in this hotel if will be in Rome!!!”
Reviews.Author: LilieMa
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for: • accommodation in the heart of ROME - for sightseeing walking 5-15 min to the main sights • clean and safe place to stay • quiet, non-noisy place to sleep • convenient place to enjoy shopping as well • plenty of breakfast with real Italian cappuccino • unexpected ratio of value/price (we have paid 112Eur for a quadruple room ) and finally • courteous and helpful STUFF supporting you even on negligible issues CHOOSE HOTEL ITALIA!! Many thanks to Andrea and the team (special thanks to Pasha!) for being so kind and hospitable- a great opportunity for us to start with people - the real Italian “content” for the fantastic Romanian “forms”! P.S. Even you have to pay extra money for air conditioning, but 10EUR are not so big deal compared to what you spend outside the hotel- this is Europe!

Reviews.Title: “A good value hotel with extremely nice staff”
Reviews.Author: chocorua1899
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for just two nights, and picked it so we could be close to the Termini train station and connecting subway lines. The hotel wound up not being as close to Termini as we thought - about a 15 min. walk. But it was about a 5 minute walk to another subway stop, and generally a pretty convenient location. The rooms were average - clean and decently sized, but nothing special and no real "extras". The people working here, however, were extraordinarily nice. One of our bags was lost on the flight over, and the hotel was very helpful in coordinating with the airline and with us to make arrangements to get it back. They always greeted us with a smile and were very friendly all around. Also, the breakfast was very good - plenty to eat in a small, cozy, dining room.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the middle of Rome”
Reviews.Author: ptshively
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the nicest people imaginable. Every night we came back to the hotel we were greeted with a smile and an offer to help plan our next day. They completely catered to us. And the rooms were great. If you can, ask for a room in the apartment level (top level). They are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay at the same price.”
Reviews.Author: theCrunch1360
Reviews.Content: We were a group of three friends returning to Rome from the Amalfi Coast and wanted somewhere relatively close to the Terminii. The location was exactly that-'relatively' close.(The cobbled streets of Rome however, make a 'short' journey, at times, quite challenging with a suitcase). Once at the hotel the welcome was a little underwhelming. Also be aware that you might as well add 10 euros a night immediately to the cost of the room. While there is the option of relying on the over-head fan, rather than using the air-conditioning (which costs the additional 10 euro) to cool the room, the noise that the fan makes and nervousness that it causes, that at any minute it is going to separate from the ceiling, really makes for it not to be an option. The towels were the softest we had encountered and no doubt were utilised to draw your attention away from the shower...which was so tiny one needeed to be a circus contortionist to retrieve the soap if you happened to have dropped it.( It was a cruel twist that the soap holder had a large gap in the base which meant that when you put the soap on it...it immediately slipped through the gap and landed at your feet...).The shower head was best utilised by delicately positioning it so that the water reflected off the tiled wall. Alternatively you could hope to get wet as it wildly snaked about untethered as it's dedicated holder was ineffective.As for hotel location,the surrounding area was good for dining options and shopping, with a supermarket and convenience store close by. The Historical Old Rome (Forum etc) was an easy walk.The staff, while not rude, displayed very little enthusiasm and gave the impression that customer service was more about going through the motions than anything else. We had paid exactly the same amount to stay at a B&B in Prati before heading to the Amalfi Coast and it was certainly better value in every aspect.Hotel Italia falls into that category of basic, functional and mediocre.You would be well advised to do some homework ande stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, Friendly staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: premium83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Hotel Italia and loved it! Unfortunately we had to cut her trip early but we will stay at the Hotel Italia next time we return. Rooms were very clean, breakfast plentiful and the entire staff were amazing. Also you cannot ask for a better location.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for a 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: gr8smiler
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Italia! Breakfast was very good, with cappuccinos provided! Easy walking distance to Termini & Metro Station (Repubblica). Longer walking distance to historic sights & attractions in Rome. We loved the exercise! We were a bit disappointed at first to be placed in the "Annex" across the street, but it was OK. I suspect that the decor in the main building probably matches their photos better. Our room was a bit sparse. All in all, very good for a 2 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great service but tiny shower”
Reviews.Author: etang
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after reading tripadvisor comments. It is on a small side street which was hard to find at night. It would have helped if we were told in advance to take the elevator up one level to reach the checkin desk. But the service was truly outstanding,. The staff was very helpful answering any questions about Rome, had good maps , excellent directions and made reservations for us. It was convenient to be able to buy the Rome pass at the hotel. Our main complaint was the tiny shower (2 x 2 ft) which was challenging even for a 5"2", 110lb person. Wish we had known before booking.

Reviews.Title: “stay here .”
Reviews.Author: karlp15
Reviews.Content: our stay at the hotel Italia exceeded our expectations by far, we booked a 2 star in order to save more money for the trip as we were attending a wedding,the hotel is absolutely spotless, we had our boys with us and the family room was plenty big enough, all the staff are courteous and as helpful as possible. Four other members of my family were let down on the accomodation they booked and hotel italia resolved their problem by managing to supply two rooms for them ,for which they wanted me to thank them for, when we go back to Rome this is where we will stay , many thanks to Sabrina, Gabriel, Abdul, Andre and all the rest of the staff, keep up the good work, many thanks karl ,diane, jack and danny pritchard

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Italia - Good Room and Breakfast - Bit of a Hike”
Reviews.Author: claydemler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Italia for 4 night (August 19 - 22, 2009) at the end of my trip. The room was fairly small, but enough room for me. The bathroom was pretty big. Overall the room and bathroom were clean and taken care of daily while I was out in the city. The hotel is close to the train station which was good since I was tired from riding the train all day from Venezia. The hotel's location was fairly distant from the "major" sites, but close enough to the metro. This made it a little tiresome at the end of each day/night to hike all the way back to the hotel. But this also forces you to stop and appreciate Rome in all its grandeur. Take your time walking and just absorbing the city, don't rush back to the hotel. Overall, Hotel Italia was a great place to stay. The hotel staff was great, very friendly and the breakfast was good. The person at the front desk arranged for a car to bring me to the airport at 2:00am. because I had a 6:00am flight out of Rome. This was really helpful. I'd recommend this hotel to backpackers and people on a casual trip, not for honeymooners or anyone looking for a romantic hotel. While I say this, the hotel was also quiet and I slept great.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem of a Hotel in a great location with a Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: IVSMOM
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Hotel Italia both before and after a cruise. The hotel is very clean and the breakfast is all you need to start the day. Andrea, Sabrina, Abdul and the rest of the staff are a joy to deal with. We never left without a map showing how to get to our desired destination. Every recommendation was just what we wanted. You cannot beat the location. I did not tell them that I work with a travel agent so I could see if the hotel was one I would refer clients to. This is the hotel for the traveller who wants a clean, well located hotel and does not need lots of frills. Just good service for good value

Reviews.Title: “Clean over priced, small rooms,tiny tiny shower bordering rude!!”
Reviews.Author: a1mominator
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent. But the hotel is very very very small, The shower is so small, that I actually put a piece of carry on luggage,(took photo as a joke) and it just about fit, width wise. Just to give you an idea! The shower doors are bi fold and dont close well, leaving a flood ,in the small bathroom, after every shower. , Paid extra for the air conditioning, but it is pre set, so it will only cool the room so much,after bringing the remote to the front desk clerk on more than one occasion! He insisted on coming in the room, and I explained my daughter was in the shower, to which he replied" well I am not going in the bathroom,and walked into the room. He turned the remote on and off and said" see it works" then left, not bothering to listen to the fact that it would only cool to a certain point, which was still extremely hot.,I also thought him entering like that was a bit creepy. The staff can be somewhat curt! They will answer what they absolutely have to !. They will answer only a couple of questions,before they become annoyed. There was no refridgerator, and no offer to store items for us. They do have an elevator, cage type which will fit , two thin people and one piece of luggage. I must say that the older gentlemen who works days, was the most pleasant and helpful,but the night guy,and sabrina , another story. The breakfast is pretty good, but they do not refridgerate the yogurt or milk.. It sits there for the entire breakfast time, in the hotel lobby without air conditioning, consequently, one of us got sick, as the milk must have soured. There is a very small safe ,(could fit in someone's purse or briefcase) and it isnt bolted down, so didnt really see the good in that! The beds are extremely small twin beds. My son at 6ft hug off the bed in length and width. I know that Sabrina will be closely monitoring the feedback, and always has an excuse for the negative comments, she was pretty rude herself at times! I will say it was clean! but so over priced for the closet they call a room.

Reviews.Title: “Could've been worse, but there MUST be better in Rome.”
Reviews.Author: TawnyaSingapore
Reviews.Content: And if we'd stayed here first, maybe the contrasts wouldn't have been so noticeable.. We met up with my cousins here, after we'd been traveling in Italy for over a week, and they picked the hotel, so I did not do any research into Rome hotels. Our double was half again more than any other hotel we stayed in, except for the luxurious Hotel David in Florence--same price for the room, but extra for parking (45 Euros per day, although hotel staff told us it would be 20) and and 10 Euros extra for aircon--which stopped working at 2AM. So, this turned out to be by far the most expensive hotel we stayed in, and certainly not the nicest. One set of cousins had room 14, which was on the corner and quite pleasant--nice size bathroom, and breezy, Another set was down a long hallway, and the only window looked out onto a filthy interior airwell, so no breeze whatsoever. Our room had a shower so small, with a fixed shower head, that it was easier to walk down the hallway and use the common shower in the hall. And no breeze, so even though it wasn't particularly hot, the room was uncomfortable because there was no air movement. So we paid extra for the aircon remote. When it crapped out around 2 AM we had to open the windows, which let in only mosquitoes and noise--no breeze, as we faced a 6-story building. It also gave 16 windows a direct view of our bed. Went to see the night manager around 4am, a very pleasant man, who tried all the remotes he had--none of which worked. Explanation was that "sometimes machines just don't work, and it can't be explained." But we still had to pay for it. It wasn't a bad location--Despar market at the end of the street, and a very good restaurant just across the street from the hotel.Ice machine did not work well, and we had no refrigerator in room, altho one cousin did. 15min walk from Colosseum. We bought the 110 Hop On Hop Off bus tickets from the front, and got the map--both were outdated, so we had a heck of a time finding the first bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location if thats all that matters”
Reviews.Author: KG20
Reviews.Content: Honest Review. I am a tripadvisor lover and always read reviews before i go as i get put off easily if reviews are bad. So this is my honest opinion for people like me. We stayed in Hotel Italia for only 1 night so we dont have much to go on. However i think i couldnt have done more than 1 night. We had room 28. Good Points: * Very nice Staff * Very clean * Discount if pay cash (make sure you ask them) * Location is excellent! 10/15 mins walk to Trevi, spanish steps and patheon. 5 mins walk to metro. Bad Points: * Wall are very thin (this was a world cup game night) we could hear next doors tv and them talking very clearly. You can also hear people in the corridors easily * Safe wouldnt work and Shower head was broken (showers are tiny i'm 5'4 and average size anyone bigger (round the middle) could not get in them. * Bed is rock hard and 1 pillow each gives you a very sore neck the next day * Bedroom fan rocks so violently when you turn it on was too scared to use it. I would recommend this hotel purely on location because you cant get better! I have pictures of room if you want to see them message me. Oh, dont use hotels tranfers either. I booked with worldtransfers and they were 32euro for 2 people as apose to hotels 50/60 euro!

Reviews.Title: “Okay experience BUT...”
Reviews.Author: Fritiof
Reviews.Content: Okay location, close to major tourists attractions. Small rooms but clean and okay equipped. Excellent as a stop over with a reasonable price. Service very good until check out when we needed a taxi to the airport. The receptionist was very eager to book a "taxi" long in advance which is not necessary. We didin´t follow his instructions which made him a bit rude and irritated. Even though we asked for a regular taxi (fixed price euro 40) he booked another one for 10 euro more. We had to argue before he cancelled his "taxi" and called a regular one. We found this a bit odd and our impression of this hotel was somewhat damaged.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience”
Reviews.Author: anuti
Reviews.Content: Hello! I just came back from Rome, where I was for a course. I had the pleasure to stay in hotel Italia for 6 nights and I didn;t regret for a moment that I booked a room here. The staff is professional, they hellp you with all you need.....everything was just like their site said it will be. It is a fair price, it's near to every main touristic atraction of the city. You can go to Termini station by foot or with bus 64, 170 (3 stops, 5 minutes), Santa Maria Maggiore it's 5 minutes walk... My colleagues all complained about their hotels and envie me. I didn't stay in the main building either, but it didn't bother me at all. I had a lot of privacy, the hotel is verry, verry clean.... and at the breackfest I had the best caffe ever, so for a traveler like me it was just perfect. The only thing I didn't like was the shower, witch is verry small. But it was ok in the end. So if you want quality and a good price...stay at Hotel Italia.

Reviews.Title: “A gem again”
Reviews.Author: envy4u
Reviews.Content: Anothr great stay at Hotel Italia. We got a newly renovated room which was very spacious by European standards. The bathroom was a nice size also. The room was spotless and we love the area that this hotel is in. Very close and walkable to all the must sees. Andrea and his staff are always so helpful. I would not hesitate to stay at Hotel Italia again or recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Don't !... and if u must, please don't get bummed off !”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELLER1973India
Reviews.Content: We checked in for 2 nights at this hotel at 8 pm recently with guaranteed reservations. Upon arrival we were met on the street by one of the hotel empoyees, Gabriel, who promptly escorted us to the building opposite the main hotel.
