When we protested he just shrugged and said that the "main" hotel was full and we had no option but to stay in this building ( it was a residential building, eerily quiet, with no feeling of being in a hotel, even if a 2 star one ) We were advised to put in our bags and come for check in to the main building. We got to the reception and politely pleaded with Gabriel to allow us a room in the main building ( not that it was anything great, but at least there was a reception, a little dining area, some signs of life and a sense of security about the place )...Mr Gabriel was rather unfriendly, kept shrugging his shoulders and (a) blamed his management (b) blamed us for arriving late ( we asked for a car to pick us up so its not like they didn't know we'll be reaching at 8pm) and (c) blamed it on some big group arriving the next day ( sure ! ). We were not allowed to call the manager and "disturb" him. He gallantly decided then to show us a vacant room ( No. 16 ) at the main building to illustrate how it wasn't different at all from what we were getting...at which point i suggested that we be given the same room for the night...after much cajoling and arguments this was reluctantly agreed to by his highness. We decided to get on with our little trip the next day and not bring it up with the manager, Andrea, who otherwise seemed like a very decent man. But I had to share this with my fellow tripadvisor users who i always count on for recommendations. Please avoid the Hotel Italia lest they try and pull a similar stunt on you !

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay at Hotel Italia”
Reviews.Author: TNtraveller37075
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights here in June before we joined our cruise. The hotel staff were very friendly and very responsive to my emails prior to arriving. Lots of nice restaurants nearby and so easy to get to the tourist locations on foot from here. We were very pleased with our room and enjoyed the free wi-fi. Next time we stay in Rome, we will definitely being going back to Hotel Italia. You just can't find a better place for the money. Alan W. Hendersonville, TN

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Chook57
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Hotel Italia for the start of our first European Holiday. Unfortunately our plane had been delayed and we were a little "travel weary" after 48 hours getting from Melbourne to Rome. What a delight then to be greeted by Sabrina - so realxed and friendly - and made to feel so welcome and cared for!! Our room was in the building across the road from the main hotel. Our room was small (probably average by Rome standards), very clean, comfortable and quiet. We were in easy walking distance of most sights (we even walked home one afternoon from St Peters via the Pantheon and Trevi fountain! The staff were always attentive and obliging. Breakfast was more than satisfying. We wished we could have stayed longer - we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “comfy rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: spark02139
Reviews.Content: This was one of two hotels we stayed in while in Rome. Hands down, we loved Hotel Italia more. The service was great, the waitstaff even knew my breakfast coffee order by the 2nd morning, and the rooms were cozy and and great value. I'd highly recommend Hotel Italia.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, reasonable price for Rome.”
Reviews.Author: BillyLa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Italia in May, 2010 and agree with all the reviews from November, 2009. It was centrally located…a 15 minute walk to the train station and within walking distance of most tourist sites except St. Peters, Vatican Museum and the Borghese gallery. Room was very clean, comfortable and quit. The breakfast was substantial. The staff was more than helpful and very friendly. We would highly recommend this hotel and remember to ask for the Rick Steve’s rate. We had an excellent dinner at Ristorante il Gabriello, which is block from the Spanish Steps. It was also recommended in RS guide. Billy La May 2010

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful introduction to Italy”
Reviews.Author: CSW1
Reviews.Content: As a first trip to Italy, it was a wonderful introduction to the country. I had booked over the internet and everything was seemless and efficient. When we arrived, all the staff we very friendly. We were in the annex across the street, had a wonderful clean room. The breakfast was a good start to the day, we were supplied with a map of Rome and also given excellent advice on close reasonably priced restaurants. Can highly recommend a visit. Can't believe only a 2 star!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JTsFamily
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my Mum in October. It was our first visit to Rome, but we wil be going back and will stay again at Hotel Italia as it was so clean, friendly and well positioned. The staff were extremely helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were lovely. The breakfast was delicious, very fresh. As I say, the hotel made our holiday and we will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fair price.”
Reviews.Author: raulds
Reviews.Content: I stayed on this hotel between May 3rd and May 7th and have to say it is a great hotel to a traveler in budget. The hotel is very well located, near Repubblica subway station and even better, not far away from Termini. So if you take the Airport express from FCO to Termini you can reach the hotel with a short walking (15 min more less). Also the hotel is a walking distance from all the majors sites in Rome. The rooms are clean and some may say small but I want a hotel to have a good rest and get ready for the next day so size not matters to me. Talking about rest the hotel has amazing showers and that makes all the diference. Hot water with good pressure. The only thing annoying is that when you finish your shower the bathroom is all wet but not annoying enough to make me upset. Leaving the hotel and crossing Via Nazionale you will find a supermarket where you can buy salads, sandwich and other groceries. That can save you few euros in a expensive city like Rome. They also have a nice breakfast with bread, cakes, cheese, butter and whatever to you start your day. The coffee is great. You have to try it. And now the staff. All the staff are very helpful and friendly and Mr. Andrea (that I believe owns the place) do all the possible to make you feel cozy and at home. What can I say: good hotel, amazing staff, nice shower, nice breakfast and with Wifi connection. For sure I will stay here again and recommend to my friends visiting Rome. Also if you pay in cash they give you a discount (that I believe is the fee from the credit card company). Saved 15 euros here. Money that I expent having fun somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Helped make it a perfect trip...”
Reviews.Author: NYUAlumCouple
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights and every aspect was a pleasant surprise. Room was bigger than we expected and clean and comfortable. Since the hotel is located on a quiet street, our room was equally as quiet (although I'm sure the sound-proof windows helped!). Of the 4 hotels we stayed at during our trip, this one by far had the best breakfast (and it was free!). They also had the best staff. All of the people that we encountered were all extremely pleasant, helpful, informative and spoke perfect English. We especially enjoyed Gabriel who was there at night to help us with any questions that we had thought of during the day while we were out sightseeing. He was certainly a highlight of our trip. We would definitely recommend this hotel to others and would love to stay here again on our next trip to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location , amazing staff.”
Reviews.Author: salad182
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on a side street off the main road between republica and via venezia, two main transport hubs in the city. For the location the hotel was very quiet. Rooms are basic and spotless.I was in the annexe across the street and room had all that I needed ,good bed, good shower , room safe. Beware; there is an extra charge for air conditioning ,10 euro a day, so budget accordingly Breakfast is very good with great coffee. The thing that makes this hotel stand out is the staff, nothing is too much trouble. need a roma pass, gallery reservations, best places to eat, best way to get anywhere,stamps(they will even post your cards for you), you name it they will try to help you. there is free internet in reception as well. The only small problem I had was identifying the entrance as its in a shared building, check the intercom on the door. Within easy walking distance you will find; a good trattoria , bakery, convenience store, atm and bus stop. I thought the location was the best thing about Hotel Italia till I met the people there. Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: KBarbata
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Italia twice and plan to do so in again in 2010. Accommodations are simple and efficient with well-appointed rooms. The staff is extremely helpful (and speak great English). A typical European breakfast is served with great coffee. They have an open sitting room that you can eat your take-away lunch at (even ice cubes, napkins and utensils were provided upon asking) and they have free wi-fi on the community laptop. The best thing about this hotel (other than its pricing) is its EXCELLENT location! On Via Venezia is the one of the best places I have had spaghetti & meatballs and pizza (Tratoria Pizzeria Al Venezia) and next door is the best bakery, fresh every day (Il Fornaio). Across Via Nazionale is a grocery store, a cafe that serves American breakfast, pharmacy, bus stops & taxis. Centrally located between the sights to the southwest (Coliseum, Piazza Navano, etc.) and the Repubblica station to the northeast. I cannot recommend Hotel Italia enough!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, clean, clean/ Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: NancyC
Reviews.Content: Hotel is spotless. Breakfast is plentiful: hard boiled eggs, sweet breads, yogurt, cereal, fruit cocktail, melba toast, strong coffee, tea, milk, koolaide-like juice, and to die for hot chocolate. Front desk is available 24/7, speak English, and very helpful. They encouraged us to take the metro to the Vatican and gave us excellent directions. We walked to the Forum/Colliseum. There is an excellent restaurant across the quiet side street, a grocery store just across Nazionale, and ATM 1 block away. There is a small Hotel Italia sign above the door that opens to a hallway. Go to the last door on the right and up the elevator to the 1st floor (in the US that would be the 2nd floor).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to discover Rome”
Reviews.Author: sebastjan25
Reviews.Content: The nice hotel almost in city centre. Nice room, cleanliness OK, EXCELLENT HOTEL STAFF, good breakfast, price value

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: psmith6187
Reviews.Content: I was really nervous because the price was just 90 euros and it was just a 1/2 mile or so from the termini rail station, my daughter would have killed me if I picked a flea bag hotel just to save some dollars. I loved it and so did my daughter. It was clean, comfortable and the service was friendly. Location is pretty good. As far as Value I would rate this hotel as excellent

Reviews.Title: “It was really nice, exept the window view and smoking smell in the room”
Reviews.Author: Katrin_Klein
Reviews.Content: We spend a nice weekend in Rome with my bf in this hotel. The room and the bath were nice and clean, but there was this strange smell of sigarets that I didn't like. Also the window of our room went not to the street, but in the yard. As there was a small pizzeria downstares all the smells from there went strait up to out window, so we never opened it. Any way for 1-2 night just for sleeping it's quite comfortable. Generally, we liked our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A welcoming staff and clean, comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: travelbugsy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights here from the Monday to Friday of Easter week and had a lovely time. We've been to Rome a few times but this was our first time at Hotel Italia. The rooms are spacious, modern, comfortable and very clean. Though we didn't really need much guidance or advice ourselves, the staff are second to none and would be such a help especially to those coming to Rome for the first time. Each one of them are very friendly, welcoming and helpful. The location is very convenient as you are a short walk from all the sites - an excellent base in Rome!! A bit of further advice - we took the train to Orvieto for the day, a hill town in Umbria, only 1hr, 15 min outside of Rome and it was absolutely gorgeous!! Though there's tons to see in Rome, it's a nice break in the countryside from the bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: GalyaOttawa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 5 nights at this hotel and we were very impressed, especially with the service. For Europe the rooms were a good size, the bathrooms were remodeled and impressive and included was a delicious breakfast (fresh pastries (that were delicious) bread, yogurt, cereal, jams and wonderful cappucino). The staff were very attentive, helpful and friendly. One felt at home. Thank you Andrea, Sabrina, Nadine and.....

Reviews.Title: “Our whole group loved Hotel Italia”
Reviews.Author: Padre_In_Transit
Reviews.Content: This was my third time to stay at Hotel Italia and my second time to bring a group. We were 25 people altogether, and once again the stay at this hotel was enjoyed by everyone. Before the trip I prepared our group for the fact that the rooms and bathrooms are small. This was not a problem since all we really needed them for was sleep (and the beds are very comfortable!). The benefits of this hotel are across the board: good location and easy access to busses and Metro; the rates are very affordable; the breakfasts are ample and delicious; the rooms are clean; many good restaurants and a grocery store nearby; the staff is very helpful. It is obvious to me that the family that owns and operates this hotel takes great pride in delivering exceptional service. I love Rome and will be back again-- staying at Hotel Italia.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, friendly, very clean and great value”
Reviews.Author: NG_DUBLIN
Reviews.Content: Incredible value. We stayed three nights, impressed by friendly and helpfull staff, the room and bathroom was very clean, the breakfast was great. The location made it very easy to get to most of the sights on foot. Best two star hotel we have ever stayed in. N & G

Reviews.Title: “very good accomodation & excellent affair”
Reviews.Author: MatteoMarinaio
Reviews.Content: I staied in Rome for a meeting and I spent 4 nights here, the first one with my girlfriend too: else if the entrance is not magnificent like other upper class accomodations (they sites at the first and thirth floor of a huge building, lift provided), rooms and service are absolutely of good level: rooms, not too big but comfortable and well furnished, services, with a hearty buffet breakfast in a nice area and internet for free directly in your room. The position is very good too, just 10-15 min. walk from the main train station and 5 min. to metro stop; above all, the hotel is adjacent to via Nazionale, one of the main street of the town, with shops, restaurants and an easy way for going everywhere (by metro, bus or else on foot: within 30 min. walk you can reach Colosseum, Venice square, Corso Italia, Trevi fountain... Almost all the main attractions in Rome! For what I paied and in comparison to other accomodations in Rome, it was absolutely an affair!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: laurb72
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, very clean, good sized room, good continental breakfast, good price. The location was great for walking to many sites and it was easy to catch the bus to get to locations farther away.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel staff stole our money from the safe - DO NOT stay there!!!”
Reviews.Author: beguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at this hotel. On our arrival we got a tiny room with no external window (only a window to an internal courtyard, which was on the same level as our room, what made it feel very unsafe). We demanded to move to another room, but we were told there was no other room. At this occasion we also deposited our passports and cash in the hotel's safe in the front desk, what turned out to be a big mistake. On the following day we were moved to another room, but upon checkout, we took our stuff back from the safe, and we were shocked to find out that 600USD were missing. The guy at the reception denied any responsibility and even HAD THE NERVE TO CHARGE US FOR THE USE OF THE SAFE!!! We are sure it was someone from the staff who took our money because we had a much larger amount of cash, and if it was someone from the outside, he would have taken it all. To sum it all up - Avoid this crook-run hotel at all costs! The guys running this hotels should be behind bars and not be "hosting" tourists.

Reviews.Title: “I Go Back Again and Again”
Reviews.Author: sand-da-man
Reviews.Content: I was looking at my contributions to TripAdvisor and realized that I had written a review of this hotel in December 2003. At that time, I had a few critical remarks. I am writing at this time, both to correct those statements and also to give my current impression of the hotel service. First of all, the bathroom towels in the room have been replaced. They are now thick and fluffy and more than adequate. Also, the breakfast provides even a larger variety of selections- lots of goodies-- including Caffe Americano should you be a traveler like me who struggles to down espresso. There are still a host of tourists from America who frequent this accommodation, but there are many if not more from a variety of other places- countries in Europe, Australia and African -as well, making my comments from six years earlier rather inappropriate. The rates continue to be reasonable for Rome, and, compared with other locations in the area (remember seasonal variations), are still a real bargain. Indeed, the quality is at a 3-star level for 2-star prices. More important, however, is that the spectacular service has not changed!!!! The friendly, helpful staff makes the atmosphere seem more like a friend's residence than a hotel. Everyone is warm and congenial, and the advice and suggestions they provide I find indispensable. I have returned here 4 times since my initial visit. I've enjoyed my stay every time. I can think of no better, nor more convenient place to stay. When in Rome, I go to Hotel Italia!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: RomanHoliday19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a double room here for 70 euros a night. I've stayed at a decent number of hotels across western Europe, and this place for 70 euros is EASILY the best bargain I've seen. Would have been happy to spend 80 - 90 euros per night here. The location is great, good sized room for "Europe on a budget" travelers (biggest room I've had for less than 100 euro per night), felt safe, helpful and friendly staff, and a shower big enough to move my arms in! Fantastic restaurant, Ristorante Al Boschetto, a 5 minute walk. A 15 minute walk from Termini train/bus station. Expect a cab ride from Termini to be 15 euros. Next time we go to Rome, this is where we're staying.

Reviews.Title: “rome is expensive, and this place is no exception”
Reviews.Author: slowlyandloudly
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I've spent 130E/night in much better places. What you get is basic: disinterested service, basic breakfast, small, noisy rooms and a tiny bathroom. There are, of course, optional extras if you want to pay for them. This includes airconditioning and the lift. Location is good, quite convenient to the train station and with easy access to the main sights of Rome, though the area could use some better restaurants. Service ranged from brusque to disinterested, though if you pushed them enough they might help you. The free wifi is a plus. If you're looking for somewhere at the last minute and this place comes up, it's okay. If you're booking months ahead and have plenty of options, give this place a miss unless they're offering under 100E/night.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel, well located”
Reviews.Author: liveeachdaytothefull
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel Italia for 3 nights in October 2009, booking a single room at a cost of 90E/night. This ended up being the most I paid for a hotel in Italy, but in searching for a decent hotel (not too expensive) in Rome before my holiday, Hotel Italia was the best I could find in a good location which was within walking distance from the train station, and having now stayed there I would definitely stay there again. I had booked a single room, was given a reasonably-good sized room with a double bed and ensuite which was very clean and comfortable. A continental buffet breakfast was included and the selection of foods on offer was more than adequate and the coffee was great. Free wifi with computer was available in the breakfast room at any time which was appreciated. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, provided a map of Rome, and took notice of who they had booked in as guests as they knew who I was and which room I was in after my 1st night there (when you go out for the day they ask that you leave your room key with reception). Reception is manned 24hours/day and there is lift access from the ground floor. Rooms were serviced daily. The location was great - on a quiet street only about 10-15 minutes walk from the train station. The hotel was located about half way between the station and the Colosseum, and thus was not too close to the seedier places near the station and it was also on the 'better' side of the station. It was also only a 10-15 minute walk to the Colosseum (and 30 minutes walk to the Vatican), so very handy to get about Rome on foot which was my preferred method of exploring. I would agree with other posts that it appeared to be quite a safe location, I had no problem walking around in the evening finding places for dinner. The only 'negative' I could say about Rome is that 3 days was nowhere near enough time to spend there, but being a 1st time visitor to Italy it gave me a good taste. I will return to Rome one day and when I do I will allow more time (and will also try to stay again at Hotel Italia).

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: DCmitch
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just perfect for my stay. Well located, central yet quiet, helpful staff, clean room with all amenities needed, excellent breakfast starting at 7am. Reasonable rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but otherwise disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Liz G
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Italia for three nights in our final stop in Italy. This hotel was the most expensive we stayed in during our trip (E130 per night). The location is fantastic, near the Termini station, historic sights like the Trevi Fountain, Piazza Reppublica etc, and near lots of shops, restaurants and boutiques. The free Wifi was also great. We were placed in the "sister hotel" across the road from Italia proper, where you have to pay for the lift. It's not much, but considering you need to pay extra for the airconditioning as well as the steep room rate, it's a bit rich. The hotel was supposed to be non-smoking, but there was a strong smell of cigarette smoke permeating our room. When I got home, the clothes in my suitcase all reeked of smoke. Our room was small, but we had just enough room to open our cases next to the bed. The bathroom was relatively newly remodelled, but tiny and there was a definite smell of drains emanating from it. The room was hot and airless, and since we didn't want to add 20E/night to our bill for using the airconditioning, we wanted to open the window. Unfortunately this meant that we were unable to sleep due to dogs barking and whining, and someone screaming early each morning. This was after asking for a quiet room! Breakfast was okay - bread, jams, cereal and coffee. It was a good base for sightseeing, and the staff were helpful when asked for directions to amenities. I see from reading other recent reviews that others paid less for their stays here. If we'd paid under E100/night we probably wouldn't be quite as critical, but the hotel certainly doesn't live up to the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in central Rome”
Reviews.Author: Blue79
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel mostly based on TripAdvisor reviews. I was especially impressed that the hotel staff took the time to acknowledge each and every one of them. I arrived late in the morning, having spent the previous night in another hotel at the end of a tour. My room was ready, which I wasn't expecting, and I was allowed to check in early. My room (a single) was small, as is standard in Europe, but had all of the facilities I needed. Several English-language TV channels was a big plus after so long in non-English speaking countries. The staff were always pleasant, and the availability of free internet was a godsend given the issues with using internet cafes in Italy. Breakfast was about average for the Italian hotels I stayed at during my trip, but I certainly didn't have problems.

Reviews.Title: “another GREAT Stay”
Reviews.Author: DCATraveller
Reviews.Content: I have to say that after many stays at Hotel Italia it is a welcoming place to stay-GREAT staff makes it all the better- Andrea and Sabrina made my very short stay comfortable and being sold out they called around the city to try to find other hotels-They went out of their to help and Thank you-I have stayed at Hotel Italia for many years and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: goto888881
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after a cruise on Cunard Queen Victoria last year. This is our second visit to this hotel and we were once again glad we chose this location. You just can't beat the price and value that they offer. Very close to subway station, totally within walking distant. Area is very lively. There's cash machine right around the corner. Great restaurant just across the street, shops and grocery store very close. This is 2 stars very basic room based on American standard.

Reviews.Title: “Clean acommodations, friendly service and good value”
Reviews.Author: ArlanS
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recommended in Rick Steves' Rome 2009 book, which listed it as a 1star hotel. It was clean, the staff were friendly, helpful and the hotel was located centrally near the main train station (Roma Termini), but not far from several tourist sites (a short brisk walk to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain), and a short walk to the Republica metro station. The room was small, but modern and the bathroom was new and very clean. Self-serve breakfast was included in the price and it was filling and delicious. I actually stayed in their annex across the street, which had its own floor in an apartment/hotel/office building.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rick Steves Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: DownEastYankee
Reviews.Content: We are Rick Steves' travelers and he suggests this street and this hotel. It is all one needs for a basic Rome visitation. Why waste your money on a more expensive hotel. This one is clean, has an unbeatable location and an excellent front desk staff. I became dependent upon Nadine. She and Sabrina gave 5 star concierge service for a 2 star hotel. Initially on the first night, her unbelievable prompt for us to walk to the Trevi Fountain proved to be a very enjoyable walk, then she suggested an opera aria for one of our nights. Sabrina tried to make reservations for us, but we were too late in the day. Simple walk-up to the box window gave us great seats. Lucky, but serendipitious. the hotel is only one block walk to the outrageously busy Nationzale with buses every five minutes in both directions, one can get anywhere without using a taxi or walking. I purchased the three day bus pass and we got on and off buses at will. Rome is a horribly busy city, but the public transport is hard to beat. They have developed a great service regimen for travelers. One service is a 50E limo service to the airport. I was going to use the Metro, but after arriving at my plane, I do not see how the Metro could have given me such direct to gate service. There is no doubt that co-ordination of plane departure is of top priority. Their 50E limo service was tough to beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: 24all
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 42 during our visit. We had booked a double room, but when we arrived, a triple was available. They gave us the triple at no extra charge. The room was very clean, and the bathroom looked as though it had been recently remodeled. Shampoo packets and soap were provided, as well as a hair dryer. The room also had a mini-fridge. We chose not to have a room with air conditioning since the weather was pretty nice, and slept with the window open. The window opened onto a courtyard and the only noise we heard was air conditioners. Breakfast was typical for a European hotel. A laptop was available in the dining room with free internet access. Overall, this was a very decent hotel in a good location. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: indytravlr
Reviews.Content: Stepping out of the elevator we were welcomed and assisted by friendly Sabrina, who along with Andrea and other staff, provided excellent service and assistance during our stay. We stayed at this hotel twice during our trip to Italy - the first time we were in one of the rooms in the annex across the street, the second time we were in the main building. Both rooms were clean and comfortable, and the breakfast service and internet access nice amenities. Also, as a traveler with physical limitations, I found the minimal number of steps to the elevators in both buildings helpful. The location is perfect for walking to all the major sites - and as others mentioned, a bus ride was only necessary to go to the Vatican. Other services we found helpful were purchasing bus passes at the front desk, the shuttle service to the airport, and especially the map and clear directions we received each day to our destinations. The quality and value of this hotel make this a top choice for anyone looking for budget-friendly, and most importantly traveler-friendly place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Price/Extremely Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: NBAZ
Reviews.Content: Hotel is only 15 minute walk from Termini Station and located on a quiet street off Via Nationale. Room was very clean, comfortable and quiet. Room size is adequate and includes an armoir for hanging clothes. Hotel staff was very friendly, spoke english fluently and were eager to help with directions (including free city map) and recommendations for restaurants nearby. Breakfast was served in main building in a nicely furnished dining room. There is a 2nd building directly across the street with additional bedrooms. We stayed at Hotel Italia twice during our trip to Italy. Our first room in the main building (a triple) had a box shower and the triple room in the building across the street had a bathtub/shower combination. We walked to all major sight seeing locations with the except of the Vatican. For the Vatican we took the city bus, which stopped only 1 block from the hotel. Highly recommend this hotel for this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for Money and a unique experience”
Reviews.Author: roughguideLancashire
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 3 nights and had a great time. We stayed across the way in the annexe which provided a unique somewhat quirky experience you wouldn't get in some of the larger more traditional hotels which are common in all cities. We felt we truly experienced living in Rome and would complement the owners on the Business they have established.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Beware88
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, very close walk to all the major transit hub. The room is very basic and is rated 2 stars based on America standard. The room is clean but very small which is typical in Europe. Staff is friendly but sometimes you get some that aren't as helpful or friendly. There is a great restaurant across the street which is another plus. Did not get to eat their breakfast as we had to leave very for an early flight.

Reviews.Title: “Cant believe its only a 2*!!”
Reviews.Author: crazymumessex
Reviews.Content: Having read a few of the latest reviews about the Hotel Italia I was a little worried but I needn't have been. What a gem of a hotel! As it was our first trip to Rome & I had organised it as a suprise trip for my husband's birthday I was really hoping that the hotel was good. We got the Leonardo Express from the airport which is incredibly easy to do and only costs 11 Euros, each we arrived at the Termini and walked to the Hotel in under 10 minutes. The staff in the hotel were very welcoming and immediately you felt at home. We were in room 12 which was on the 1st floor, it was a lovely room which we both thought was a good size for a city central hotel, the bathroom was spotless and we had a flat screen TV. The beds which had a been a topic of discussion on previous reviews were great, yes they were firm (not hard) and we slept very well please don't let that put you off. They were made every day and the room was cleaned to a spotless standard. As I said earlier this was our 1st visit to Rome but in the afternoon on the day of our arrival we walked to the Colosseum in 10 minutes max, then onto the Piazza Navona (20 Mins) and managed to at least see all of the main sites. To say that this is a hotel that is convenient for visiting sites is an understatement, yes you do need to do a fair bit of walking if you really want to see Rome but this is an excellent base to start from. We only got 1 bus and used the Metro once in the whole of our stay but walked the rest of it. Overall we loved Rome, the people, the food and definitely the Hotel Italia, we cant recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, best service, best value.”
Reviews.Author: Arkansastraveler69
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful introduction to Rome. The proprieters were very helpful, and friendly. Even before we arrived, we had several e-mail exchanges. They answered promptly and clearly our questions and made very helpful suggestions. They arranged for our pick up at the airport, and transportation to the port. The location could not have been better. Within walking distance to all the main attractions. Bus service on the corner -- 50 feet away. Romapass is the way to go. Between the bus and the subway, you quickly get any where you want very economically. Pass and maps provided by the hotel. As a plus, a free breakfast is served .... plenty. Fresh rolls, fruiits, cereal, coffee, milk, pastries, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler81
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to all the good reviews we had read. It was close enough to the Termini Rail Station that you could walk from there, as we did, but far enough that I never felt unsafe in any way. Make sure you have a real good map showing the street that the hotel is located on, as we did not and did have a little trouble finding it. It is on a side street right off of Via Nazionale. From the hotel we walked to the Trevi Fountain, Pantheon and Piazza Navona. All within easy walking reach. We even had dinner in Piazza Navona (farthest point) and walked back to the hotel. Also the metro is a few short blocks away and we did take it to the Vatican and that was also easy. There are a lot of buses that leave from the immediate area to all points in Rome, just ask the hotel staff. The hotel is located on an upper floor (2nd or 3rd) and there is an elevator, which is usually not the case in hotels of this category. We really appreciated the elevator after walking with luggage from the train station. We had reserved a quad room for my family and it was definitely big enough with a queen bed and two twin beds, and a mini-frig. The bathroom was very nice with marble and also toiletries were included, again rarely seen in a hotel of this category. The hotel room itself was clean and nicely kept. We had breakfast in a separate room that seemed to be used only by the people staying on that floor (we were on another floor separate from the reception area). In fact that morning we were the only ones eating there. The breakfast was adequate enough to start you off on your day. I would definitely return to this hotel again when visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Roman Surprise”
Reviews.Author: LuckyLuch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a hotel close to the city center at a reasonable price. A trusted co-worker recommended hotel Italy and emails between Andrea and myself started. I had lots of questions about Rome Which connections andrea patiently answered. We got to Rome and found an old building with a quaint cage elevator. The main lobby with computer access was bright and pleasant, the room was clean and comfortable, tasty breakfast was a plus. We're very happy to have found this hotel. They even assisted us with information re side trip to Florence and reservations to the Uffizi and Accademia.

Reviews.Title: “GEM OF A HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: YEEMOI
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and it's quaint and clean rooms. It is in a great location to the termini station and there are nice restaurants close by. The staff was exceptional and they accept your credit cards. Breakfast was just right for a light bite in the morning. There were 5 of us and we had 3 rooms and I know we would return to Italia on our future trips to Rome. Thank you so much for the great and friendly service. Had I known about your shuttle service from the airport and also to the port, I would have used you instead. Next time........ Alice and Bern from Rio Vista, CA

Reviews.Title: “Cacncellation policy sketchy, pay to use EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: tripoz
Reviews.Content: If you visit the Hotel italia Roma website there is NO cancellation policy listed (that i could find) and te cancellation policy listed via bookings assist does not state anything about cancelling 1 day of your stay. I found the staff unhelpful to the point of being rude especially when the cancellation email was sent 5 days prior to the day that needed to be cancelled. The email was not received apprently and due to the lack on understanding english the policy listed on booking assist is quoted to no end. I am very disappointed with this hotel. The bathroom is tiny to the point of sitting sideways to use, you pay for the elevator EVERYTIME and you cannot open the windows lest you be besieged by th noise from the steet. I have stayed in a 2 star hotel in Florence and it was miles and miles better than here. The plus is that i got a double room rather than a single however the price is no different in either so the upgrade is pretty meaningless. Wifi works well but so far it is the only plus point. Never staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, okay accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Jen4582
Reviews.Content: I heard about this hotel from my travel guide book (Fodders). Fodders had said the rooms were very small, clean and cheap. Which is all true. But when I looked up the hotel on line before I booked it, the rooms looked much different. On line, the two twin beds were separated (double occupancy room) and it looked bright and airy. Our room was not like that. Our beds were together and the furniture just looked very old. We did have a huge window, but no sun light came in. Our room was across the street from the lobby, which meant in order to use the internet and have breakfast, we had to walk across the street. The hotel does not use any kind of key card so in order to get into the front door of the building, you need to use a regular key... as well as another key to get onto your floor, and then another key to get into your room. When you got into your room, you had to lock the door behind you with the key. It took some getting used to. The hotel offers free internet in the lobby, but there is only one computer and every time I went to use it, someone was on it. The rooms do have free wi-fi but I was not traveling with my laptop. The hotel did experience two blackouts during our stay, but luckily since we were staying across the street, we were not effected by it. The Colesseum is about a 15 minute walk away. The bus to the Vatican is right on the corner. Complimentary breakfast is served every morning (cereal, pastries, danishes, coffee-the basics). If you're traveling on a budget, this is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for our First Visit to Rome”
Reviews.Author: Florida3
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with Hotel Italia. We stayed four nights during our first trip to Italy. The best features for us were the extremely helpful staff, who spoke excellent English, and the location. The rooms were nothing fancy, but clean and adequate. The size of the rooms and the hard beds with thin mattresses and pillows ARE a shock your first time in Europe, but we were prepared for that and it was the same everywhere we stayed. You do have to pay an extra 10 euros for air conditioning, but it was worth it. While the hotel is on a side street, it is off of the very busy and loud Via Nationale, so the room was too noisy with the windows open. Our room was in the annex across the street, up three flights of stairs. There is an elevator, but we couldn't quite figure out how to use it! We felt both the room itself and the location were safe. Upon check-in, Nadine answered all our questions, provided a map with key sight-seeing locations highlighted, and helped up make museum reservations. We were also able to purchase our Roma passes at the front desk. Breakfast was adequate, with yogurt, cereal, pastries, and fruit cocktail. Cappucino is available upon request. Very nice breakfast room gives you an opportunity to meet and chat with fellow travelers. Location was excellent- 15 minute walk to the colosseum and Trevi Fountain, 20 minutes to the Spanish Steps, and 10 minutes to the closest metro stop. Also within 5-10 minute walk of many, many cafes on nearby side streets.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in quiet area near everything!”
Reviews.Author: sandstrom
Reviews.Content: There are nothing bad to say about this hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful, room and bathroom were clean (were stay on the other side of the street than reception). Short walk to everywhere, about 15min to Colosseum and we had nice evening walks to Trastevere (well, after eating we went back to hotel by taxi =) Street, Via Venezia, was quiet little street, no traffic noise. Area is safe, we walked there very late of the evening, there are always quite much people (tourists) in streets so we feel very safe. Small minus comes about beds. I don't expect luxury but for my opinion bed and pillows were too hard and uncomfortable. But still, that didn't matter that much that I'm not coming to hotel Italia back if I'm ever come to Rome again. Than you!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kosha
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful 3 nights at Hotel Italia at the end of August. It is very central, clean and lovely. Very friendly and exceptionally well managed, with great breakfast and free internet access. Sabrina is an Angel! We were going on a cruise and Alitalia lost our luggage (what else is new??) She did everything she could to calm us down and help us to get it back the next day. It was a pleasure to stay there. Andrea and Gabriele were also very helpful. Everyone spoke excellent English and provided assistance with everything, from calling cards and transport & tour tickets to all kinds of info. Can't wait to go back. Thank you so much for making it such fun experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Choice for Stay in Roma”
Reviews.Author: theworldsmyoyster
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Italia for four nights at the end of August/beginning September 2009 with my family (2 adults/2 children) in the a quad room. We travelled down from Tuscany having stayed the previous week in a rustic villa rounding off our holiday and I have to say that we made a very good choice with this little gem - the air-conditioning was such a relief after having none at the villa (you do pay extra though). OK, so it may not be 5 star accommodation or the smartest hotel I've ever stayed in but it is spotlessly clean and very comfortable but the thing that really makes this place is it's staff and we found each and everyone of them helpful, polite and very efficient. The breakfast, whilst not elaborate, was more than adequate and made this hotel even better value - the cappucino was delicious and my daughters both highly recommend the hot chocolate. Add to this a quiet little side street, peaceful enough to enjoy a restful nights sleep yet conveniently situated within easy reach of most of the main sites and all this adds up to a very good bet if you are looking for an excellent budget hotel in Rome. I would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great”
Reviews.Author: EdwardSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: I landed her around midnight, and it was such a relief after an arduous trip on a bus from Rimini that landed in Tiburtina rather than Termini, and having been somewhat ripped off by a cab driver that landed me in the wrong block and drove around an extra long block that he didn't have to (this is my only problem with Italy, the cab drives like to rip you off and got one of those 50 euro tickets on the bus b/c I forgot to meter my ticket, even though they saw I had a blank ticket that I had just bought a few minutes before), so was feeling a little down, and when I got to Hotel Italia, they were absolutely wonderful. The night clerk spoke excellent English, and helped me to the room. It was about 95 F outside, and the airconditioning worked VERY well. It was the first time I was cool in about 5 days. The morning staff at breakfast was very sweet, and made you a capucino to your liking every day. The staff at the desk was very nice, and told me the "little secrets" about, buy this here, that there, etc. They must go out of their way to help their staff to be friendly, and they all seemed happy to work there. I would rather stay here than at a 4 star hotel, it was also extrememly clean.

Reviews.Title: “great location, clean, friendly, would stay here again-good value”
Reviews.Author: zinchow
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights at the beginning of August. I like the location as it is very near to the train station and is 10 minutes walk to most of the major sites. It was just of Via Nationale, on a quiet cobbled street, so no problems with sleeping. Not that far from the Trevi fountain either. The room was a good size and clean with a comfortable bed. It felt like a safe area. it is also just down the road (walk up 5 minutes towards the station) from a lovely church which has classical music evenings by candlelight. The owners were pleasant and professional. The breakfast was adequate. I think it's great value and would stay again. (Oh and they also have free internet acess from a laptop)Thank you Hotel Italia for a lovely stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Several pros, but a couple major cons.”
Reviews.Author: Eudora_7
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the recommendation of friends, and appreciated its inexpensiveness, convenient location to major sites and transportation, good breakfast selection, very pleasant staff, and free internet access. We experienced, however, two significant cons: We rented a double and a single (the only one in the hotel, I think). The single was located apart from all other rooms, off an outdoor courtyard (noisy early one morning) containing an assortment of stuff. It felt isolated and not quite as secure as the interior rooms. It was also quite small, but that we expected. (We inquired if another room, single or double, was available, but unfortunately all were taken.) While otherwise quite clean, there was a large amount of mold/mildew on the upper portion of the walls of our bathroom in the double, and the room had a definite mildew aroma, which many of our clothes unfortunately acquired.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: cultural_addict
Reviews.Content: The staff was all wonderful! Very friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was quite adequate, typical Italian fare (bread and pastry, some fruit, yogurt, cappuccino, ect). The rooms were spotless.The location was great, it took me about 10 minutes to walk to the train station and about the same to walk to the coloseum from the hotel. Highly reccomend for a good, safe hotel in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip in Rome”
Reviews.Author: medina15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Italia in July 2009 for 7 nights and we were very satisfied with the room, service, staff and location. The hotel staff continuously helped us with our daily travel activities with good suggestions, mapped out the best routes on a map and helped us with our museum and tour reservations. Also, the hotel was conveniently located with a 10 minute walk to the train station or a 15 minute walk to the Trevi fountain.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Value, Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Smithycanberra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Italia in May 2009 and thoroughly enjoyed this hotel and the wonderful city of Rome. The hotel was spotlessly clean with hot shower (although very small) very quiet at night and in a great location for exploring the city. It was only about 10 - 15 minutes walk from Termini and right near the bus stop to all major attractions. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the free internet access was also a bonus. The breakfasts were really nice as well. We would thoroughly recommend this hotel. Craig and Mary Canberr Australia

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, fairly central, very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: IvanSF
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights at the end of our honeymoon. Good value, for Rome. Staff were very friendly and helpful, breakfast was great, and the free wifi connection worked well in the room, which was clean and not too small. The walls were a little thin, so it wasn't totally quiet in the morning, and the aIr conditioning was ten euro extra charge, but I understand this is standard in Roman two-star hotels. Location is okay, about 10 minutes walk from the historical sights.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the traveller on a budget”
Reviews.Author: sjlovelee
Reviews.Content: We just landed back in NYC today after a night at Hotel Italia in Rome. We stayed there for two nights in the beginning of our trip, travelled to Florence and Cinque Terre, and returned to the hotel for our last night in Italy. We found the staff extremely friendly and helpful. They gave us good directions (by foot, train and bus), recommendations, and practical information about getting around Rome. Our room was very clean and comfortable. The bathrooms were tiny, but perfectly clean. Our only complaint was that air conditioning cost extra, and since we were on a budget, we were a bit warm. Perhaps this is standard for a two star hotel though? I am 6 months pregnant (and was during my stay there), so if I could survive the heat, I would imagine most could. We also found the location to be really convenient. We walked to the Colisseum, train station and Trevi Fountain (reminder: I'm 6 months pregnant and not walking as lightly as usual). Being from New York City, we can appreciate a good location in an urban setting!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful trip to Rome”
Reviews.Author: barbsoluri
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd stay at the hotel. The room we had was beautiful, it was just remodeled the bathroom was hugh and all tile. Special thank-you's to Sebrina and all the front desk staff, could not have inproved anything about our stay. The food was fresh and plenty of it. Having access to the computer made our granddaughter feel connected to home. The front desk had someone help us with our bags when we left. They also helped us with bus tickets, tour tickets and even advised us about the length of our granddaughters skirt for entrance to the vatican. Thank you again for a wonderful time hope to return again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service, and location”
Reviews.Author: LindaAndMichael
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel in Rick Steve's book, then checked out the reviews here. We were on a budget, so we had to ensure that we got what we needed for the money. And, we did !! It's a cute little hotel, located on the 2nd floor (3rd in US). Most of the time, the front door was locked, so you have to be buzzed in, which is good, because it's safe. The surrounding area was safe. Definitely clean. Room was made up everyday. Shower was small, but it should be ok if you don't move around much. Bed was comfortable. we didn't get backache. Room was quiet, but boy, once we closed the windows, all the outside noise was blocked 90%. Free wireless, so it's convenient for our iTouch. But, they do have a laptop you can use out on the lobby. Service was excellent. Thanks Gabriela (that's a he)!!! :-) Breakfast was good; croissant, chocolate croissat, yogurt, fruits, espresso made to order. There's a market across the street on Nazionale that was used a lot by us to get different items. Very convenient. Close to everything. There's reallly no complaint about this hotel. To get good eats, ask the hotel for recommendation. We got jibbed the first time, so we asked Gabriella for recommendations and we tried them all. There was one, don't remember the name, that we loved so much that we went back the 2nd time. Gabriela also had good tips on which place to go before the next, so that we could avoid the long lines. This saves us lots of time. You'd be walking a lot. Get the Roma Pass. We'll miss Gabriela. He is fun to watch when he's talking. You'll know what I mean when you talk to him. :) Rome now will always have a special place in our hearts, as we got engaged there !!! Will definitely be back. And we do, we'll definitely stay here again. Room 24, to be specific. Say, what is that 2nd looking toilet for? Forgot to ask when we were there. Since we didn't know what it was for, we didn't use it. :) Don't change Hotel Italia! We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great find for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Freedom068
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 15 min. walk to the front of the train station and an easy walk to the Spanish Steps, Colosseum, The Pantheon, The Forum, just to mention a few. The bus to the Vatican is just around the corner. They had wonderful free maps at the front desk. The staff were friendly and helpful. It was on a quiet street and had free internet connection and a wonderful continental breakfast was included in the price. We expected the small rooms, but they were clean and quiet. We enjoyed our stay there and would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Centrally located, within walking distance to many sights.”
Reviews.Author: mtngoater
Reviews.Content: We found this in a travel guide book. They came back with the best rate out of the three other hotels in their class. When we arrived, we were greated by a friendly staff and given a nice clean and quiet room. We found that we were within walking distance to many of Rome's attractions: Spanish Steps, Colosseum and The Pantheon to name a few. There are several nice cafe`s within a block or two. In retrospect, we knew we picked the right place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice place, close to train station”
Reviews.Author: Mrsb918
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights - not too far from the main train station, and on a quiet street in Rome. The room was small, but we weren't there to hang out in the room. The location is good - close to the Metro, the Roman Forum and yet still in a quiet location. Not many good restaurants in the area. There are two buildings for this hotel - we stayed in the room across the street from the main lobby. It was a pain to walk across the street for breakfast, but that was our only complaint. The front desk staff were incredibly helpful and there was a computer that we could use - free of charge!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Find!”
Reviews.Author: Flannery52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 3 nights at this lovely little hotel (16-19 April) and will do so again when we visit Rome. I read many reviews before choosing Hotel Italia, and we were not disappointed in this final decision. While the room and bathroom are small, we knew that ahead of time, and since we were getting on a cruise ship soon, we didn't mind not being spoiled with a large room! Moreover, we were in our room so little that the tight space was no problem. We loved the location, choosing it because of its proximity to Termini. But in actuality, it was close to everything for us. I do admit we are walkers, but aside from the Vatican (which we did walk to), the major sites in Rome are simply not that far away. The staff at Hotel Italia is its strongest point. Sabrina was so friendly and helpful. One evening manager (wish I'd caught his name) was especially helpful. He'd seen that I was having trouble making phone calls from my room (I was now in the lobby on their free laptop - another nice touch), and he offered to make the call himself! He tried several times. Another staff immediately took care of some noisy girls in an adjoining room. We were impressed with all the staff, and the ones who help with the breakfast buffet were attentive as well. Great cappuccino, but do beware that the breakfast is fairly basic. It served us well, however, and if you need more, there's a grocery store across the street, which we used. Ricca Est is a terrific restaurant just a couple blocks away. We ate there twice, and we felt it was a good sign that locals were lined up to get in. Take advantage of the free internet, travel books, terrific staff, and outstanding location.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget option”
Reviews.Author: Adventurer610
Reviews.Content: The hotel has two buildings across the street from each other, and I had the chance to stay on both sides since I was in Rome twice through the course of my trip. In both instances, the rooms were comfortable and clean. The breakfast is a little leaner than at more expensive accommodations, but it met my needs. The staff was friendly and helpful, and the free internet access in the lobby was a nice touch. Located within talking distance of the main train station, the Repubblica subway stop and the Imperial forums, the hotel is a nice, budget location from which to explore Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: bureau1103
Reviews.Content: After looking at so many hotels and reading so many reviews here in tripadvisor, I chose Hotel Italia for my stay in Rome in my European tour. I was NOT disappointed. The room was on the small side but I was expecting this as it is the standard in this part of the world. Being in Rome for the first time, I was not sure of the location of this hotel relative to the tourist sights. When I arrived in the afternoon, I just walked around, got lost on the streets and did not expect to see the Colosseo quite close by. The location is very convenient. I'm someone who usually do not like walking but once I knew where the hotel was, I practically walked back to the major tourist sights, like the Collosseo, the Forum, Piazza Venezia, Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps to name a few. Arriving at the hotel, I'd recommend to walk from Repubblica Metro station, it would take you at most a good 10 mins. dragging your luggage with you. It is located on a side street from one of the major streets, Via Nazionale where a number of buses pass through yet a distance away that you would not hear any street noise. The hotel is on the first floor of the building, you need to get on the lift with your luggage. At the corner of Via Venezia and Via Nazionale, there is a grocery store called Desparo, where you can buy water and food. There is also a bookstore on Via Nazionale if you need to purchase a guide book! There is a good Trattoria Venezia right across the Hotel that serves very good pasta. And on the next street, Via Genova, there is a good restaurant and a cafe as well. The staff were so friendly and helpful. And as mentioned on one of the reviews, the smiling waitress who served me tea each morning was very pleasant. Breakfast was included and it consisted of 3-4 kinds of bread (croissant, pastries, etc.), different kinds of spreads (cheese, jam, etc.), yogurt, good old cornflakes and tea, coffee or cappuccino. Small details that made my stay here very pleasant were: free wifi internet, free use of their laptop at common area, availability of a a plug adapter, guide books you can borrow for free, ice, knowledgeable staff and a towel you can step on after a good shower. Will be back at this hotel on my next trip to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “A nice, convenient place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jperkin1
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 adults stayed in a quad room for 3 nights. The room was adequate for 4 people, a little on the small side, but we do expect that, and we are in the room for so little time, that it is not that bad. It was quiet, the staff was accommodating and very friendly, the location was great and easy to get places. The breakfast consisted of cereal, fruit cocktail, sweet rolls, yogurt, juice, and coffee. If you are looking for a convenient, nice place to stay the Hotel Italia worked great for us!

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raif_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a good location within 15 minutes walking distance from the train station, and is a good starting point for exploring different areas of Rome. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are quite small, and for me the bed was somewhat short. The breakfast is ok, but quite simple. Overall, I think the hotel provides good value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Warning Do Not Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: rjsavill
Reviews.Content: Please do not stay at this place. They put us in a "broom closet" sized room across the street in another building. Walls were paper thin. Staff is rude. Accommodations horrible. They are liars and you can not trust them.......be very careful and think twice before you stay at this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value and location!”
Reviews.Author: goingfor50
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights in March 2009 at Hotel Italia. It's not much from the outside, as there is just a small sign on the outside, and you have to go up to the second floor to the front desk. And if you return to the hotel later in the day, they have to buzz you up. It appears that all the rooms are on one level. However, even though there is no grand lobby, the room itself was nice and actually larger than most hotel rooms in Europe that I've been in (Room #10). Bathroom was small, but that's typical of Europe. Breakfast is average. They do supply a computer in the dining area to check e-mails, so that is a plus. The staff was very friendly as well. The hotel is located about 10 min from Termini and 10 minutes from the Coloseum. We took the subway to the Vatican, and taok a cab to the Trevi Fountain area, as it is a much longer walk. This hotel is a hidden gem for travelers on a budget. I would definitely recommend to others. Thank you Hotel Italia

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: realjewell
Reviews.Content: Hotel Italia Roma March 8-9, 2009 Hotel Italia Roma is in an excellent location, a very walkable distance from Termini station, in a safe, relatively quiet neighborhood, just off Via Nazionale, one of Rome’s main thoroughfares. It is an easy walk to Trevi Fountain, and the Colliseum and Roman Forum are also well within walking distance. Via Nazionale is also a major bus route, and metro stations are only a short distance from the hotel.The hotel itself is not elegant, but very adequate. The staff seemed friendly, although we were only there for one night before moving on to Venice, so we did not have much of an opportunity to interact with them.Our room was a bit careworn, but clean and comfortable. The bathroom was functional, though small. We slept well, even though in the midst of a big city. I would stay again at Hotel Italia Roma and consider it an excellent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “tiny and basic”
Reviews.Author: daisyonthego
Reviews.Content: This hotel has absolutely no frills. But you get what you pay for as it is very reasonable. It is located near the subway which is the best way to get around Rome. The room we were given for our family of 5 was tiny and one of the beds was actually placed in the hallway right outside of the tiny bathroom. The walls had absolutely no decoration on them and the view from our window was of the fire escape ladder. The restaurant right outside of the hotel was cheap and excellent (although we never had a bad meal while in Italy) I recommend the ravioli with butter and sage sauce. We only were in the room to sleep as sightseeing took most of our days, so it was acceptable. Next time, though, I'd spend a little more money on a different hotel with some Italian character.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: skyfliers
Reviews.Content: Found out about this hotel in a Fodor's travel book. Very friendly staff, great location, clean room. Bring your earplugs if you are a light sleeper and if you like to sleep with the windows open. Decent breakfast, nice to have use of free internet. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: rogueelephant
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel, tucked out of the way but located in a convenient spot in town. The staff were the friendliest I encountered during my whole European vacation. We stayed for four days, and every day when we came back from sightseeing, the room was pristine and our pajamas were folded on our pillow! I recommend the place highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient quiet hotel”
Reviews.Author: JesterDog
Reviews.Content: I always imagine that I like family run hotels, and I do not know if the Italia is one, but it certainly has that feel. It feels like people who look after you because you might be back in three years time. Most places are easy access on foot, Parthenon, Trevi-Quirinale fountain, other destinations can be easily reached by bus. 64 goes to St Peter's - Vatican. I recommend getting a bus map €2.50 from tourist kiosk on Via Nazionale, and day bus tickets at €4.00. These expire at midnight so are best value if you buy them early in the day. We stayed at the Italia to see the Bellini exhibition at the Scuderia Quirinale which was very close. I was very pleased that we managed to find such a nice hotel, so close to the centre, with handy local restaurants and bars and yet very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous time at Hotel Italia”
Reviews.Author: KPOPS
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our fabulous trip to Rome with our two young teenagers. We chose to stay at the Hotel Italia primarily because of location and price. We were happy to find that our room, although small, was clean and comfortable for the 4 of us. The staff was extremely helpful with every sightseeing or transportation question we had. (Thanks Sabrina and Nadine!!). And the breakfast got us started off on the right foot for long days to wander around the city. We were able to walk to most of the major sights because of this hotel's great location. (But we took the bus to the Borghese Gallery and the subway to the Vatican.) If you are looking for a hotel that is centrally located with a wonderful staff to return to after a full day of sightseeing, then this would be the hotel for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, even better staff”
Reviews.Author: BrownsFan40
Reviews.Content: Our most recent stay at Hotel Italia was our third in the last 6 years. We stay there because of it's central location, because it's an excellent value, but most of all because of the staff. They are very helpful, very friendly, and very understanding of guests that do not speak more than a few words of Italian.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value !”
Reviews.Author: envy4u
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Italia for 4 nights in November. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed in Room 10 which was larger then most rooms however as mentioned before the bathroom small. This hotel is perfectly situated to visit all the "must sees". I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again and would recommend it to anyone who is looking for a clean and affortable hotel in the heart of Rome. We paid 90 Euros cash per night. The bakery and restaurant across the street were convenient and very good.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Italia's our kind of place! ;>)”
Reviews.Author: JanieandPete
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel staffed by wonderful people! Sabrina, Ippolito and the owner are great. Convenient location to everything. We travelled mostly by subway (underground?) and bus a little. They serve a very nice breakfast, free laptop usage. If you're there in the summer, like we were, the A/C is terrific!! There's a convenience store up the street across Via Nazionale where you can get whatever you might need. The room rates are very reasonable too! One more thing, there's an opera concert held at St. Paul's (I don't know if it's inside the walls or outside the walls) a few blocks away on Via Nazionale that's very entertaining to say the least. Tre salute poich‚ albergo l'Italia!! Janie & Pete - Las Vegas, Nevada, USA

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: PT_EURO_2008
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerk, Nadine lied to us and told us they replace their towels only every two nights because they were just a two star hotel; when we asked for clean towels. This was to punish us for taking our keys with us during the day and hence they never cleaned our room. I guess she thought we should have known better. We were not told that returning the keys to front desk when leaving the hotel was their policy. Of course coming from North America, this procedure is non-existent. Also the introductory e-mail of confirmation misinforms you and tells you that it is a $15 euro cab ride for a $15 minute walk from the train station. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from the hotel and a $5 euro cab ride. This is basically to convince you to take their $60 euro pick up service from their airport because you are extrapolating the cab ride $ amount if a 15 minute walk is already $15 euros. We found out the flat rate for a cab is $40 from the airport to anywhere in central Rome. Andrea does not enjoy dealing with people and will not listen to you. He will simply turn off and say "you are impossible to talk to" Overall the service is not acceptable!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - staff, location, room, breakfast”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelers
Reviews.Content: This room was recommended by Rick Steves. We used his Italy book to chose rooms for our trip. From the Termini station, the hotel is within a 15 minute walk. The easiest way is to go northwest out of the station to the Piazza Repubblica and turn left at Via Nazionale and left a few blocks down at Via Venezia. After we arrived and received a warm welcome, we were taken to our room in the building across the street. The new part of the hotel is located on the 3rd floor. There is a lift, but we never used it. By the way, the 3 people at the reception desk that we ran into during our stay spoke English very well. And, there was someone always available. The room was small, but we expected that after lots of research and reading of reviews. It was fine with us, there was a double bed and a small desk and chair in the room. There was also a very small TV that would pick up CNN off and on. We were there right before the US election, so my husband would check in while we were in our room. The walls, however, are very thin, so you can hear people in the next room. No one was ever too loud. The bathroom was especially small, but there was always enough hot water for us both to take a shower in the morning. The was a hair dryer available, although it was a hose attached to the wall. The bed wasn't the most comfortable and there was a lot of street noise outside our window. We had earplugs and shut the window if it got too loud. With the window shut, the noise was muffled enough to go back to sleep. Breakfast was next to the lobby. There are 6 or 7 small tables in the room. During our stay, they served pastries, cereal, a yogurt and fruit mix and coffee, tea, or cappuccino. They also had a laptop in the lobby for guests to use for free. We used it a couple of times to check our email, which was the only way we kept in touch with family. We didn't bring cell phones. The location of the hotel to the sites is great, especially the Colosseum. It was a 15 minute walk there. We also used the Metro, Repubblica stop, when we were too tired to walk back or to go to Vatican City. The Metro is very easy to use and cost 1 Euro for 75 minutes of travel (on all public transportation). Buy your tickets from the machines, you can chose different languages. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for a nice place that is affordable and close to sites and public transportation. I felt it was in a very safe location. Feel free to PM me if you have questions.

Reviews.Title: “Customer focused at Hotel Italia, Rome, Italy”
Reviews.Author: TrueHearts
Reviews.Content: Hotel Italia served the four of us adults in an excellent, professional and friendly manner. They booked our transfers from the airport to the hotel, from the hotel to our port for a cruise, and from the port back to the hotel. They also booked transfers from the hotel to the train station. Taxis were called everytime we needed them. They also helped us with train reservations. They made suggestions on excellent restaurants. All of these accommodations were done in an excellent and proficient manner. We were extremely pleased with their exceptionally clean, orderly, and comfortable accommodations. We cannot say enough good things about their efficient and helpful staff. We highly recommend this hotel which is in an ideal location within walking distance to the restaurants and business district. We would definitely book this hotel again in the future. This hotel was listed in Rick Steve's book which is the reason we booked them, and it will be the Hotel of our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel,service & location!”
Reviews.Author: scooterscruisers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Italia two wonderful nights, room # 3. Very clean and spacious! Bed was comfortable and bathroom was nice - even supplied toiletries. Continental breakfast was lovely and the cappucino was great! Hotel staff was amazing, friendly and helpful - both before and during our stay. Email communication before our stay was extremely quick & efficient - even when we missed our flight connection in London we emailed on our blackberry to notify them and reschedule our airport pickup with their driver - they reassured us and he was there waiting for us at 11:30pm! We were also impressed when we checked in this late, that Gabriel had an email from our family back home worried about our flight delays and we were able to reply right away. Computer with internet available for guests right in the lobby too. I was so happy they had Roma passes available for purchase at the front desk - an added bonus we would highly recommend! Easy walk to sights like the colosseum/forum & museums. Front desk provided a handy map & directions. We booked this hotel on Rick Steves recommendation and were not disappointed - lived up to all our expectations and more! As a travel consultant, I will recommend the Hotel Italia to any of my clients travelling to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: DCCNewJersey
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Hotel Italia, the first was 4 years ago. This time I brought my parents back to Rome for their 50th wedding anniversary gift. They had not been back to Rome in over 30 years. I wanted them to feel like they were living in Rome once again so I rented the apartment run by Hotel Italia. It was perfect - elegant, spacious and spotless. I had asked the staff if they could purchase flowers, spumante & a card for my parents room for when they arrived and without hesitation they agreed and what they purchased was just beautiful! The staff (Andrea, Sabrina, Nadine, Gabriel, Franca - sorry if I forgot anyone) were always very warm, friendly, and most helpful with every need. Knowing the staff was there to help my parents while I left and traveled a few days gave me peace of mind. The location of the hotel is central to all the major sights and all the conveniences are within walking distance, a bancomat (bank of rome) is on the corner, a grocery store is across Via Nazionale, a great little pizzeria and bakery is directly accross the street on Via Venezia. Plenty of restaurants and shopping are nearby. The computer in the lobby with free internet is a plus and the breakfast is good. Hotel Italia and the entire stafff made our stay in Rome and my parents anniversary just wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “A great deal for a good room”
Reviews.Author: TerryVH
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay in Roma - spent one night in Hotel Italia at the start of our trip, and three nights at the end. Okay, so the mattress is a bit hard for my liking, and the rooms a bit small - but the price was great! The location is superb, putting almost everything in reasonable walking distance (we walked everywhere - Spanish Steps, Vatican, Gallery Borghese, Coloseum). The staff were very helpful. The breakfast provided was good, and the server was excellent. The bathroom was adequate to our needs. Internet and laptop were very convenient. And its got a great funky elevator! The room we had overlooking the street was a tad noisy in the evening, but when you closed the window it was fine - and not stuffy - and the noise didn't continue through the night. Great basic restaurant across the street with a nice varied menu. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: rosefarmer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Italia is in a great location. Safe and close-by to all of the sites you want to see in Rome. Our bathroom was SUPER small and would have become bothersome if we stayed there more than 1 night. The breakfast was lovely and the laptop available for internet access was very helpful. All in all, an average stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value--would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Pwalen
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room in main building & was pleased with my accomodations. Was a perfect booking for my 4-night stay & I would book again (excellent for day-tripping from Rome or even a shorter stay).
