It's close to Termini, Colosseo, Vittorio Emanuelle & Piazza di Spagna (all within 1 mile walking distance or a short bus ride) & also central to restaurants & shops as it is right off Via Nazionale. Very safe & centrally located, for you other single female travellers out there. Room was a decent size for a single & well-kept. Slightly noisy (I was placed near the stairwell) so when booking, ask ahead for a room away from the stairwell as they fill up quickly. Photos on site & venere.com are pretty accurate for main building. Breakfast was adequate & la signora made me lattes when requested (you only have to ask once!). The staff were great (Ciao Sabrina! Grazie mille per tutti!) & very helpful. It was so convenient being able to purchase my Roma Pass directly from them (same price as advertised elsewhere in Rick Steves) & they even sent out my mail (letters & postacards). Had good recommendations for laundry service, euro exchange (but they also provide these services onsite) & free internet was a plus. They offer more than other comparable hotels I experienced during my 15-day trip across Italy (tour bookings, Roma Pass, mail & laundry service, bar, room service, free internet, car service to/from Fiumicino Airport and more...). Great value.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service - Room was ok”
Reviews.Author: Jenipod
Reviews.Content: We arrived on a Thursday night and asked to make one small change to our reservation. The clerk said she was happy to help, and put us in a nice room in the main building. The room was actually fairly large for a European hotel, and had a decent bathroom (the shower leaked and the toilet seat was broken), but overall in good condition. The next morning we were told we had to move because a family wanted to stay all int he same area of the hotel. Normally, this wouldn't be a problem, except for the following. They told us they would move our belongings if we packed them up. Instead, they left them sitting in the hall all day, and made us move our bags across the street. Which brings me to the bigger issue. The hotel advertises free internet available in ALL rooms. We were told the only way we could have internet access in the other building is if we could pull free access from the restaurant below. My husband's work allowed him to take off a day from work, as long as he completed some tasks (for which we needed internet access). Despite explaining this repeatedly to the staff, who spoke fluent English, we were told our only option was to stay in the room across the street. The clerk said that because I originally asked for the change in the reservation, they were not obligated to honor their advertising stating they have free internet in all rooms. I asked if I could cancel the reservation and book somewhere where they do no not have false advertising, and was told that my only option was to take the room they offered. In addition to no having internet access (which resulted in my husband having issues at his place of work, and ruined 2 full days of our holiday), the room they placed us in was about half the size of the original room, with a tiny, broken bathroom. The toilet seat was almost completely detached from the toilet, the shower nozzle wouldn't stay in it's casing, and sprayed water everywhere, and the room was so noisy from 6am-1am that we literally couldn't hold a conversation (I believe there was construction going on, in addition to the normal noise of a busy street in Rome). I was really disappointed because I thought for 140 Euros a night, I would have a little better service, and that I wouldn't have to put up with bad attitudes - the bottom line is, the hotel is okay, but the staff just simply didn't care about providing what they advertise, and made absolutely no attempt at offering alternatives - the best they could offer is that my husband could come over to the main room and use their laptop (thus inconveniencing all the other guests, and making him work in a busy, noisy room).

Reviews.Title: “just ok”
Reviews.Author: backfromeurope08
Reviews.Content: overall not bad for Rome, but the room and bathroom is very small. the cab ride from the train station was a total rip off. 15 euro for a 5 min ride was a total waste, but it was night time and we didn't want to walk. breakfast selections were decent. the lady who was working at the front was friendly in a way you felt she had to be and almost ripped us off when questioning prices for entrances to some monuments that day (she was trying to sell us a tour package through the hotel). the walk from some of the sites at night is a stretch.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Friendly, Well Located Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SherryinChicago
Reviews.Content: We recently returned to Hotel Italia when we visited Rome in early Sept with my parents and we once again were very happy with this clean, friendly, well located hotel. The hotel has been owned by the same local family for 20+ years and the staff is very helpful and friendly. They had great restaurant recommendations, assisted my parents in booking a tour and made our stay enjoyable. We stayed in the annex across the street. After staying in both the annex and the main building, my preference is the main building.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: redmack25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really neat. Actually I thought it was more of a pensione as there were people living there as well. There were two parts to the hotel and you had to ring the bell for reception, get buzzed in, walk up three flights of stairs and then your actual room was across the street! It did cost money to use the antique elevator so we walked up and down stairs. We stayed on the third floor so it wasn't too bad and with the way we ate it wasn't a bad thing. The room was smallish and I couldn't get a good shot of it but it did have a balcony so you could leave the doors to that open and get a breeze. We enjoyed the hotel the bed was comfortable, the shower facilities were modern and the staff spoke English and could provide maps and dinner recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kakie39
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the hotel for my first time visit to Italy. We stayed there four nights and couldn't have been more pleased with our accommodations and the helpfulness of the staff. The breakfast got us off to a good start, the folks at the desk answered our many questions and helped us with museum reservations. They were helpful when I tried my broken (and limited) Italian although they spoke excellent English. The location was within walking distance of many of the historic sights and handy to public transportation. The room was immaculate. I heartily recommend a stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very European--a good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chappzack
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay at the Hotel Italia. Our quad was across the street in a second floor annex--it was fine. However, the main building would have been a bit more convienient.....Very nice and cordial staff. The hotel is very clean and is in a very good and safe location. They serve a nice breakfast and offer free use of the internet. There is also a charming bakery across the street, it is worth checking out. We were pleased with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, Hospitable, and Helpful”
Reviews.Author: GelatoRoma
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 17 day trip to Europe. The last 3 nights were spent in Rome at the Hotel Italia. Rome is hot and we wanted our last stop to be a great one. The hotel staff were extremely warm, hospitable, and friendly. They went out of their way to make our stay be worth our while. Everything from where to eat, how to get tickets for busses, metros, tours, being careful of certain busses for pickpockets, the best routes for visiting certain places, setting up our taxi ride to the airport, and even checking on us at 345 AM to make sure we were ready for our ride to the airport-all of these little things were done with a lot of caring. Thank you Hotel Italia. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Freindlt Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liv42day
Reviews.Content: Great location to all the historical sites and the busses and trains. Easy to acces Rome landmarks by train or bus or a nice walk. A European hotel with clean rooms and friendly staff. Excellent breakfast to start the morning. Located on a quiet side street in the heart of the shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Convenient, Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clr2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days (2 adults and 9 yr. old son). The staff was wonderful, everyone spoke very good english (as our italian was limited to asking for beer or wine). Hotel was close to Termini (since we were hauling our luggage) and close to convenient bus lines and metro. We were able to cram in a lot of the tourist sites thanks to the staff's help on which buses/metro's to take. We met several of our former ship-mates who were very unhappy with their hotel(s) so we were pretty happy with this one. On the downside, the bathroom shower door is a squeeze for a med. build person, but most bathrooms in Europe seem to be smaller. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaSeniors
Reviews.Content: We found Hotel Iatlia in a travel book in 2001, and have stayed there 5 times since! We have never found better treatment in any other hotel! It is a 2-star value better than many 3-star hotels! The rooms are spotless clean with comfortable beds; great breakfast (and coffee!); 10-15 minutes walking distance to major attractions, and excellent shopping area, but the best is the SERVICE you get from the Valentini Family and their staff! We are a mature couple, and we plan our own trips, so we rely in the hotel staff for any help we need. At Hotel Italia we've never been disappointed! In 2003 we both got very sick with the flu. Andrea called a doctor and moved us to the room closest to the front desk, so the night staff could be available to us. That showed how much they care for their guests! The size of the rooms are not important to us, since in Rome we only stop to fall in a good bed exhausted!!! But you can always ask for a larger room with a view, and I've seen the Staff do all they can to please their guests! That's why, when in Rome, Hotel Italia is our "Home away from Home!" And, we'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent , Clean , very good receptionist”
Reviews.Author: DANIELE44
Reviews.Content: We stay several time at this very comfortable hotel in Roma. The price is excellent for the location ,8 minutes walking to the Coliseum .Buses going direct to the Vatican from Via Nationale. Very Clean and Friendly . A lot of help from the receptionist, Nadine and Sabrina. Very quiet and comfortable We will be back soon. Daniele and James ROSE 3440 Sunset Ridge Dr Merritt Island FL 32953 USA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Service”
Reviews.Author: DarekJarmola
Reviews.Content: My March 2008 stay was so enjoyable that I returned again in May 2008. The owner and the staff are the major reason that I came back - reception desk is fast, accurate, and professional. Our rooms were very clean, breakfast was always fresh, and free access to the internet was a huge plus. And employees were always friendly and always ready to help! Hotel Italia is the place that I will come back to; it is a great value for the money and a great place to call home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: MiPiaceItaly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 5 nights at Hotel Italia. The location was very good: about a 20-minute walk from the train station, even when pulling our luggage, and only about a 5-minute walk from the Metro. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. There was a shared laptop in the lobby, which was handy for checking on train schedules, planes, etc. The breakfast was good (rolls, fruiit, yogurt, cereal, juice, coffee). The room was small but very clean and comfortable. There was a lot of road noise (the streets are paved with stone and this seems to increase the noise from the many mopeds and cars). Luckily, the nights were cool when we were there and, once the windows were closed, the noise was barely noticeable. There is a small elevator to get from the lobby to the first (what we in the U.S. would call the second) floor. A very good pizza place was located about two blocks away. One block away, on the main street of Via Nazionale, was a bar that was a good spot for a late-night drink and people-watching.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Much”
Reviews.Author: vjdjr
Reviews.Content: A very basic hotel. It's up on the first floor (which is one floor above the ground floor for fellow US'ers). A small lift will take care of most of the steps if you have problems walking, but it is NOT wheelchair accessible. The staff was very helpful in getting us accomodations. (There were 4 adults the first night, 2 the 2nd. We got a quad room, and the other couple got a double for the next night.) The room was basic, but not uncomfortable. The staff remained helpful and friendly for the most part. The room was clean. It was basic but don't expect anything beyond basics. Shampoo, for instance, was in single-serve envelopes. It was very inexpensive, but you get what you pay for. Location is good, within central Rome, not far from Termini (which is not always a good thing).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TS_VictoriaBC
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Italia. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They really enjoyed meeting the guests and I enjoyed them. We had a quad room for a family of four which was spacious by European standards. It was clean. We also had a small leak with the shower as others have mentioned, but nothing the towel mat didn't absorb. The breakfast was good and ample with lots of drink choices. They had a laptop I borrowed a few times to email home which was nice and convenient. It rained while we were there and there was no smell of sewage as mentioned in other reviews and our window opened into a service alley. The thing I loved the most about the Italia is the location. We walked from the train station to the hotel carrying backpacks with two kids in 15 minutes with no issues. We walked everywhere with a 6 and 7 year old and everything was within 15 to 20 minutes easy walking. The Colloseum, Trevi fountain, pantheon, Spanish steps. We took the bus to the Vatican (only 10 minutes) and the metro to San Giovanni (could be walked). The area around the hotel is great too. The bakery across the street is very reasonable and has good pizza and biscotti. Had lunch with cookies, drinks and pizza for four for 10 euros. There are lots of restaurants around as well. The best we found was Ricci Est, Est, Est. It is a block away has been there since early 1900,s and very well priced. It was lined up a few nights, but worth the wait. The food and wine are both good and cheap. The panna cotta was fabulous and my kids still talk about the lasagna. The shopping on Via National just around the corner is pretty good too. Some nice shoe stores. We also went to a great market at San Giovanni on Saturday, very busy but lots of great buys. Mostly locals shopping, ask at the front desk. The Italia was a good hotel for the price. Clean, safe area, great staff, decent breakfast, excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “2 Star Hotel w/ small rooms”
Reviews.Author: FoodiesInChicago
Reviews.Content: We booked this 2 star hotel room based on TA reviews and were let down. While we understand European hotels are small by American standards, this was still quite small. The room had a queen size bed with a 2 foot border around it to walk. My wife and I couldn’t pass each other at the same time. The paint was chipped and there were stains on the bedspread. The room had a ceiling fan but looked like it might fall on us at any moment. The windows opened, but it seemed to overlook someone’s back stairwell. Luckily we didn’t stay here for the view. Our room was next to the common WC and we had an ice machine right outside our room. It made so much noise that we almost asked to switch rooms. Thankfully we were so tired every night we were able to get right to sleep! The walls are also paper thin, so you hear every noise in the hallway. The bathroom was very small, but clean. They provided towels, soap and shampoo for us. The shower was the smallest we’d seen during our trip, so small that washing your feet was a challenge if not impossible. If you bumped the doors in the shower, they opened and water got all over the floor. The toilet was unbelievably noisy, even by European standards. We could also hear when someone else used the faucet or toilet above us. They offered a buffet breakfast of cereal, yogurt, breads, pastries and even pizza one day. They get these from the bakery across the street, so if you can get the room without breakfast, do it and go to the bakery. They have great pastries and the best pizza we had in Italy! The staff was, for the most part, very friendly and helpful. The two ladies were the best and made several suggestions for sightseeing and restaurants. The gentleman who works in the day is nice, too, but the night desk clerk is cold and very unfriendly. They usually have a computer for guests to use but it was “in the shop” when we stayed here. One of the ladies said that after 7 PM we could use their computer to get online, but when we asked the night clerk, he said “No.” Not a big deal to us, but it might be to some. The hotel is an easy 15 minute walk from the train/bus station and Trevi fountain. It’s about 40 to Vatican City, but the train is easy to take. They offer train/bus tickets at the hotel. They also arranged for a car service to take us to the airport @ 3:30 AM for only 50 euro, which is a fair price. They did offer a 10 euro/night discount for paying cash. While we didn’t want to spend much time in our hotel, the time we did was unpleasant and we will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Aetatis
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were in Rome for a brief visit. We needed a nice place that would be close to everything. We got it at this hotel. The hotel room was nice enough and was clean. Plus it was in a decent neighborhood in Rome. Right around the corner on Via Genova is a wonderful Pizzeria that has been operating in Rome since 1900 or so. The front desk was always open and could answer questions for the traveler. The clientèle was an interesting blend of Europeans and Americans. Unlike other hotels in Italy the staff seemed to enjoy the different people that came in. We got back one night to see a british gentleman in conversation with the clerk on duty. Something that was amiss with most of the other hotels during our italian trip. The breakfast in the morning was pretty decent. Basically a continental with coffee. Which as the euro rises hit the spot knowing that I wouldn't have to find a breakfast place in pricey Rome. My only qualm was that it was a bit pricey. But when you check prices for the other hotels in Rome it is consistent if not a bit cheaper than the other Hotels. If you travel from the main train station know that the fare should be something like 5-8 euros. We got ripped off at a flat fee of 15 euros. Later we found out it was pretty high. Also there is a lift/elevator to the Hotel on the main floor of the building the hotel is in. But you probably will take the stairs. The lift looks like something out of a horror movie. You'll understand it when you see it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Italia a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: sandy1548
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hotel Italia 2 times and would definitely stay again. Rooms are a good size, very clean and with good views in the annex. Breakfast room is cheerful and food plentiful. Location is almost walkable to most sights. Price is excellent. But, the reason I would reccommend this hotel the most is the charming, warm, friendly staff. They went out of their way to accomodate our every request, and this really makes you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: fishballs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel Italia for 2 nights in January. This is my 5th time back to Rome and have always on previous visits stayed in and around the spanish steps erea. This is a better location, as everything is within walking distance. 15 min to termini , and most other attraction is within easy reach. The room is small but clean ,shower fine. and the breakfast is good.. Continental style with bread, pastries cereals and fresh tea and coffee. There are loads of restaurants and pizza places near by. Difficult to recommed one , as most of them are very nice. The self service restaurants are ok, but its microvawe pasta etc. Better going to a proper place and the price is no dearer. The staff in the hotel was very friendly and always willing to help, The receptionist helped us print out our boarding cards, which is a great help as we had on line check in with ryan air. So thank you! The hotel is set in a back streeet so there is little noise and once you have your map, easy to find. Reception is on the first floor. I would stay there again, as the location is great and for about £90.00 a night per room the price is right as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LuvSLO
Reviews.Content: My parents found this hotel for our trip to Rome and it was a great stay. Location is very good. Close (as in a 15-20 minute walk) to the train station, Colosseum, Vittorio Emanuele building, etc. Room accommodations were typical of Italian hotels but in fact our room was slightly larger than others I've stayed in. We stayed in a double and it had a nice wardrobe to hang clothes in it, a very warm radiator, a small tv and ample lighting. Our bathroom was small but this is to be expected in Europe. The hair dryer worked but needed maintenance because it didn't stay put in its base. Also the shower leaked and got the floor wet but it wasn't a big deal. The breakfast selection was also typical Italian fare--yogurt, cereal, canned fruit, brioche, bread and nutella. The great thing was they served you beverages as if you were in a bar/cafe, so you could order freshly made cappuccino, hot chocolate, espresso, tea, etc. The room rate was extremely reasonable at Christmas. I believe it was about 90 EUR per night. Front desk staff was courteous and helpful. I saw in other reviews that the hotel building smelled when it rained. We did not experience this when it rained while we were there. Overall, this is a good hotel to stay at if you are passing through for a few days. It's certainly not spectacular but it is fine for travelers on a budget that would like nice, clean accommodations and free breakfast. Restaurant tips: Rinaldi's was recommended by the hotel but it was extremely overpriced and had only mediocre food. Granted, this was on Christmas eve, but I would suggest asking for another restaurant if they recommend this one.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: letstravelwithtwins
Reviews.Content: I first heard about Hotel Italia by reading Rick Steve's. It was one of the few hotels in central Rome that could sleep 4 to a room, was air conditioned, and was on a side street. Plus, the price was in line with expectations. We paid 200Eu for the Quad room plus an extra 10Eu for the A/C. Overall, or stay was great. The location is perfect. You can really walk to all the sights. Or easily pick up the metro from near the train station. Plus the city tour hop-on, hop-off buses also leave from nearby. The hotel is close to shopping and to the supermarket. We were able to load up on waters so that we did not have to buy from the street vendors. Lots of good restaurants nearby for dinner. After a long day of touring, we'd shower, rest and then dress for a later dinner like they do in Italy. Perfect that so many restaurant options were close by. Here are the positives about Hotel Italia and our room: -great location -quiet side street -A/C worked GREAT -fixed problem with our toilet quickly -very nice, friendly staff, made us reservations and would offer suggestions as to what our 8 year old kids would like Here are the negatives about Hotel Italia and our room: -VERY small room. I mean microscopic. We didn't spend much time there but it was cramped -room was not in hotel, but across the street in an apartment building. Felt a bit disconnected from the hotel and had to hike up and down 3 flights of stairs with our luggage at check in and check out -Hallway in this other building was VERY loud. Could hear every door open and close and the buzzer ring for access to the apartment building. -there was no dresser or drawers to put clothes. AND no room to put the suitcases. Room so small that we had to stack suitcases. Really could use a dresser -no towelbar so no place to hang wet towels. -Breakfast is skimpy. Good as a wake-up quick snack but doesn't last you until lunch. Mainly was cold cereal, yogurt, canned fruit and some bread. Coffee, Tea and Hot Chocolate were awesome though

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Stepalex
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked via Venere.com. Stayed there for 5 nights with my girlfriend. The overall experience is positive - breakfast was fine, room was ok, the hotel is really 10 min from Termini and about 15 min from Piazza Venezia. The only thing to mention is that the managers, though fulfilled our (few) requests, did it quite unwillingly. Overall, taking price into consideration, I give it 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Italia in Rome was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: GottaloveItay
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Italia for 4 nights in September, 2007 and 2 more nights in early October on our way home to Canada. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. The location was perfect for us. A 10 to 15 minute walk from the train station. The hotel is located only a few yards from Via Nationale, a major shopping street. The location was close enough to walk everywhere for us with many very affordable restaurants close by. We found the breakfasts very good and they serve it from 7 a.m. until 10 a.m. which gives you a chance to get an early start on your sightseeing. The rooms were nice and very clean. We will be returning to Rome, a city which we both love and will definitely be staying at the Hotel Italia again.

Reviews.Title: “It was a GREAT hotel !!! Excellent !!!”
Reviews.Author: OhioItaliantourist
Reviews.Content: I thought it was a GREAT place to stay ! From the very beginning , Nadine and Gabrielle at the front desk were so very nice and friendly. Both spoke very good english which trumped my bad Italian ! They were so helpful my whole 5 day stay. The room was comfortable and clean ! The hotel is VERY CENTRAL to just about EVERYTHING !! 15 min. walk from the Central Train Station. The continental breakfast was good for a great start to go site seeing. I want to take this time to THANK all that work there and I hope they get to see this. They made my stay in Rome wonderful !!! Ciao & Grazie !

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: historykev
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel in a very good position. Our family (two daughters aged 9 and 7, myself and my wife) stayed in room 36 afer reading reviews on this site. It was large, clean, and generally comfortable. The only downsides were that it overlooked an alley so couldn't open windows for very long because of unpleasant food smells from nicely decorated but overpriced place below the hotel and that, while we paid 200 Euros per night, the sign in the room said maximum 170 (minus breakfast?). We found the staff very helpful and friendly. Impressively, the hotel bent over backwards to be fair. When a taxi we had booked through them did not turn up upon our arrival, they refunded both the money for their taxi and the money we paid for the taxi we were forced to hire from the airport. A question - why are taxis 60 euros from Campigno rather than 30 as the city of Rome advertises?

Reviews.Title: “Very good little place”
Reviews.Author: Ishmayel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 3 nights in early Oct., our first visit to Italy. A small hotel, on a narrow street, one block from bustling Via Nazionale. It shares big old buildings with another hotel, and other businesses. Very strange for us Americans, but intersting. 15 minute walk from Termini train station, 10 minutes to nearest Metro stop. Easy walk to most sights; easy Metro ride to Vatican. Two cafes just outside the doors on the street We were assigned a room in the annex, across the street. It was OK size with good en-suite bathroom. Unfortunately, our window opened to a street that was a construction site, with unbelievable noise starting at 5 AM. An inconvenience to go back to the main reception to get info, drop off/pick up room key, etc. Mostly stairs, partly lifts. Staff very helpful. Continental breakfast was good, with usual pastries, meats, cheeses, juice, hot drinks. Would stay again, but try to get room in main building. Good value for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “good value for central Rome”
Reviews.Author: bellini6
Reviews.Content: I found booking by email with this hotel simple and efficient. It is VERY convenient in a side turning off Via Nazionale about 15 mins walk from Rome Termini station. There are numerous trattorie and ristoranti in the streets around the hotel so eating out is easy after a hectic day of sight-seeing. We stayed one night at the beginning of our holiday and another night at the end. The first time we were met by a charming girl at the street door and taken to the 'annexe' which was just across the street. The room was basic but clean with excellent shower and we were able to book in right away at 11.30am. Breakfast was served in a small area off reception and was busy at 9am so we had a wait but not for too long. On our way back we had a room in the main part of the hotel which had the tiniest shower imaginable and I managed to flood the floor of the bathroom as the shower screen did not fit properly. However, overall, this hotel represents good value for central Rome. It's clean, comfortable and the reception staff and breakfast waiting staff are all charming and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Italia is Great!”
Reviews.Author: padrematt
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms, a triple with a child and a single for three days in August 07. I can not say enough about thier customer service and how they accomidated us. We arrived very late, 3 am, and it was not a problem. They gave us great travel and sightseeing advice (skip bus #64). Very close to the old center, great transit a few steps away and a good little restaurant below. I would definately recommend. Of all the hotels we stayed at for 3 weeks in Europe this is at the top.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: WIBadgergirl
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Hotel Italia for one night pre cruise and two nights post cruise. Wonderful little hotel with the basic necessities. Front desk was extremely helpful and very polite. We enjoyed the breakfast provided - usually yogurt, croissants, cereal, fruit and coffee. We had two different rooms and each was unique in their own way - small but clean and comfortable. Our travel agent booked this hotel through venere.com for 140E per night and they gave us a discount for paying cash.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first choice!”
Reviews.Author: MNHawkeye
Reviews.Content: This hotel is average at best. The staff is not very friendly. And be prepared for when you arrive at this hotel, that you may have to take a room that is across the street. If you can, have a fellow traveler stay with your luggage on the street until you know where you room will be. It is located on a noisier street, and breakfast is quite average. Instead, some of us went next door to a bakery that had pastries that were to die for! One group of hotel patrons had to wait FOREVER for the hotel desk attendant to let them in off the street, because the main door was locked. And this was only at 10PM at night. On a good note, there is an outdoor restaurant next door that is nice if you want to enjoy a glass of wine or bite to eat at the end of the day, without walking too far.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: barve
Reviews.Content: Hotel Italia came up through a search I did on TripAdvisor and later on venere.com also. Since most of the reviews were positive, I decided to go ahead and book and was not disappointed. The hotel is very close to the Station Termini in Rome. The cab ride cost us 6 euros including luggage and a walk to the station takes only around 12-15 mins. The hotel is located just off Via Nazionale, which is a great location, because you can walk to some of the attractions like the Roman Forum (about 20-25 mins) and the road is also great to take buses to other attractions in the city The hotel turned out to be much better than I had expected. It is clean and the staff is very helpful, especially Nadine, who gave us very useful tips for bus rides and the best times to see some attractions in Rome. The room itself is small, but clean and neatly organized. The bathroom is really tiny, but looked like it had new fittings and was therefore ok. However the flush in the toilet did not work very well. The hotel serves a fairly decent breakfast - croissants and rolls, yoghurt, cereal, canned fruit, preserves and spreads and some good coffee. The road can get a little noisy in the mornings, but if you keep the wooden shutters closed, its fine. All in all, Hotel Italia was a great stay for our first time in Rome and I would definitely recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: burke56
Reviews.Content: I want to thank Hotel Italia for their compassion for a frustrated traveler. My husband and I were flying from Chicago to Italy for the first time and had planned only one night in Rome. We choose Hotel Italia because of the great reviews and the location. Unfortunately when we arrived in London their was a air traffic controller strike in Rome and we could not get a flight out in time. We had to spend the night in London then take a early flight to Rome then our train to Florence. With MUCH disappointment we had to cancel our room at the Hotel Italia. Although Hotel Italia has a cancellation policy that you must pay for one night when canceling the staff that answered the phone was gracious and very understanding of our unfortunate predicament. He immediately calmed my fears that I would not have to pay for two rooms, one in Rome and London, and expressed regret that my first trip to Italy did not start out as planned. He WON OVER a future customer!. I received no hassle but a sincere understanding. I may not have stayed at Hotel Italia but wholeheartedly will rate them a 5 in hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “very central”
Reviews.Author: lamboDundalk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Hotel Italia Sept 07.Great Little Budget Hotel on the quiet via Venesia just of the very busy via Nazionale. This is a fab little hotel .Don`t be put off that you have to buzz in to the second floor of an apartment building. Go upstairs and you will be greeted by very friendly staff who speak perfect English Rooms very clean ,but the shower is tiny as is the norm in this class of hotel. Breakfast is basic, good coffee ,crossent fruit,rolls,etc. Good IRISH BAR just up the street .But why this hotel is so good is the access to (Metro….Piazza della Repubblica .Red Line …Temini Red & Blue Line All the buses.. Just be careful ….Station Termini and the area around gets bit doggy after dark) …Get a map…get some shoes,…brush up your Italian and enjoy the sites ,food. and culture of the most fabulous city on earth!!!!…Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Small, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: kj3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our 2 children, 13 &15, in the heat of July. It's a great location, 15 minute walk from the train station, and 5 minute walk to the metro and major bus stop. We walked or took public transportation everywhere. The room was small but clean, and the airconditioning worked well. It was refreshing to come back to the room to rest during the hotest part of the day. The staff speaks excellent English and were very helpful with confirming plane reservations, recommending restaurants etc. There is a bakery across the street with delicious pizza. It was a frequent stop with our teenagers. Because the hotel is not located on a busy street , it was quiet at night and we slept well. The breakfast room is cheery with a typical breakfast (hard & sweet rolls, cereal, yogurt, canned fruit, and delicious coffee) It was a great hotel from which to explore the fabulous city of Rome.

Reviews.Title: “stinky, dirty and bugs, do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: ChiLisa
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed here April of 2007 after reading good reviews on tripadvisor. It was terrible. First our room was spacious, but pretty run-down and there was a terrible chemical smell in the room and especially on the towels. We later found the source of the smell must have been some kind of pesticide because we open the closet up and there are ants crawling all over our coats and shoes!! The concierge's response was "they are just little ants, no problemo, no other rooms available" It was our 1st time to Italy, and it's true what they say, don't stay near Termini station!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel Italia in Rome”
Reviews.Author: greentree33
Reviews.Content: In July we stayed for four nights, renting two rooms for a party of six. Hotel is central and is an easy walk from the Termini - about 8 to 10 minutes with suitcases in tow. Also easy walk to all major downtown sites - even the Vatican would have been walkable were Rome not experiencing a heat wave. This made an afternoon siesta very easy. Metro station was very close to hotel as were restaurants, shopping, grocery store, etc. Staff were exceedingly pleasant, knowledgeable, and spoke very good English. Breakfast was great for a hotel of such a small size, and rooms were very clean and serviceable although not fancy. Rooms and showers varied in sizes and configurations. Entry at street level was the seeming foyer of an apartment building with stairs or a small elevator up to a pleasant lobby. By all means pay the extra and get air conditioning, especially if you are visiting in the middle of summer! Mornings and evenings were wonderful times to be out and about with the friendly staff always ready to greet you on your return regardless of the hour.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, safe B&B”
Reviews.Author: Lab804
Reviews.Content: If you enjoy walking (which we do) the location of Hotel Italia is good. Warned of pickpockets, we decided not to use bus transportation and walked from Termini to the B&B. We had packed light (backapcks) so this was no problem. The Republica Metro stop is just a few blocks away. We used the Metro to visit the Vatican and the Borghese Gallery--otherwise, we walked. Our double room was in Hotel Italia 2 which is across the street. We had easily done without a/c in Florence since we had a ceiling fan so we tried to do without it in Rome (a/c costs an extra 10 euro per night). There were no fans in our Hotel Italia room and the street noise required that windows be shut. The second night we began paying the extra 10 euros. The room was small but big enough for us. A hairdryer was attached to the bathroom wall. Our view was of a side street (see photos)--nothing really to see unless you hung your head out the window to view a small park. Hotel Italia 2 is on (what we would call) the 3rd floor. There is a lift but you must pay each time with the correct coin (0.10 euro). We paid 94 euro per night for our double (including a/c). The breakfast was OK--good coffee, yogurt, toast, brown bread, croissants, canned mixed fruit and spreads. The cleaning/serving staff were very nice and efficient. The desk staff were helpful with one exception. The gentleman working the evening shift was very rude to my 20 year old daughter when she asked to use the internet. I'm sure that if I had been with her, he never would have behaved so badly. We felt safe on the streets around the B&B up to 10:30 or 11pm--we chose not to be out later than that. Since there are so many B&Bs in Rome, I'm not sure I would stay here again but it was fine for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Rome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christinelisa
Reviews.Content: SInce this Hotel was within the budget range and less expensive than many I had checked out, I wasn't expecting much. (We wanted a moderately priced hotel for our last 2 nights of a month long stay in Europe.) My husband and I were plesantly surprised with this little gem. It was a lovely, bright, friendly, clean hotel in a central location in Rome. We walked there from the train station (15 minutes). From the hotel we could walk to all the major sites. Breakfast was delightful (included) and we found the hotel to be a good value for under 100 euros a night. It was on an interesting street, close to restaurants, and the staff was especially helpful. The room was small, but adequate, and tastefully decorated. I would easily recommend this accomodation to people who are on the go and sightseeing most of their time, and in need of a clean, quiet, comfortable place to stay in a convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Hotel Italia”
Reviews.Author: mi456
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night in a single room with bathroom and shower for 60 euros. The room had no view at all (I had to keep the shutters closed) but was clean and neat and perfectly pleasant. Air conditioning was 10 euros extra. Free internet is a nice perk, and the front desk has metro/bus tickets for purchase right there. The staff is very friendly and helpful, always willing to give directions, hand out maps, etc. It's a very central location and a nice area. If you are looking for something simple and inexpensive, this is a good choice. I didn't have the breakfast, but it looked fine.

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: jsandoval562
Reviews.Content: Considering the last minute booking this was a great find. The room was very small as was the bathroom. My son worked around this by using the shared bathroom in the hallway which had a much roomier shower. I liked the location. The Metro was just a couple of short blocks away. There was plenty of activity within walking distance. Breakfast was tasty and plentiful. American style coffee as well as expresso. Best of all was the staff. All very helpful and sweet. I'm sorry that I have have forgotten your names. We were allowed to store our bags there on our last day in Rome and use the shower prior to departing that evening.

Reviews.Title: “Good price, good shopping around”
Reviews.Author: EmmCee
Reviews.Content: Hotel Italia is not in a great location if you're looking to do the tourist thing. It's in the core, but you'll probably need to take public transportation (too far to walk to many attractions, although 15-20 minutes away from the Coliseum). We had a quad room and it was really small. The bathroom was also really, really small. The only small window couldn't be open. You really needed to use the a/c (for 10 euros a day extra) to keep such a small room at a decent temperature, (since there were 4 of us in such a small place), even though the temperature outside was not very warm. Breakfast was average. Internet access was intermittent when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Hotel Italia”
Reviews.Author: mzbossyboots
Reviews.Content: I was in Rome for 5 days/ 4 nights. I arrived about 10am the room was not ready but the staff pointed me to a bathroom where I could freshen up. I had forgotten to make reservations for the Borghese Gallery and the staff was able to quickly secure me a 1pm reservation! Everyone was always very helpful. They have free internet access in the lobby. It is only one laptop shared by everyone so you may need to wait but as I mentioned before it is free. The hotel is very centrally located. I was traveling by myself and was able to walk to the train station with my baggage without a problem. There were also many bus stops very close and the taxi stand/stop was just down the street. My room was small but I did not spend too much time in it, so it did not matter. The room was clean and the shower was bigger than the one I had in Venice. They also had air conditioning in my room, which was great since the weather was in the 90's to 100's every day. I made the reservation based on Rick Steve's recommendation and I am glad I did.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: LadyGBD
Reviews.Content: Hotel Italia is recommended by Rick Steves and is one the reasons why I chose this hotel for my 3 night stay April 29-May2 2007. I stayed in a single room. Reasonably priced hotel rooms in Europe, in general, are small by comparison to the states. (I am one who would prefer not to spend 200-300 Euro for a place to sleep.) The single room had a single bed, night stand, wardrobe with plenty of hangers, a safe, toilet/shower area and a window that looked out into a court yard. There is also optional airconditioning at 10 Euros per day. The hotel is on the first floor with a small lift to help with luggage. The staff begins their day early, I did hear the maids outside my door each morning. To deal with these minor distruptions, I always bring ear plugs. I used them and all was great. There was also free use of a laptop in the lobby to check email, etc. The staff - Sabrina and Nadine especially, were outstanding and so helpful and pleasant. The location was ideal. I walked to the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and the Coleseum. It's about a 12 minute walk to the train station. I happily recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Location is great room is not”
Reviews.Author: briachel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last 3 days of our trip and what a disappointing way to end our stay in Italy! We had wonderful rooms in Pisa Florence and Cortona. Wish we could say same about Hotel Italia. It is in a great location,walking distance to many attractions. Room was small even by European standards. Bathroom is even smaller. Couldn't leave suitcase on floor-there wasn;'t room to walk around it couldn;t even open it on the floor it had to be on the bed. The hotel is very noisy. You can hear everyone walk down hallway with luggage and hear laughter through walls. This breakfast had the least variety of anyplace we stayed and did not have bottled water or even cold water to drink. We found this place very depressing.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, safe”
Reviews.Author: DeskJobDaydreamer
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location (off of Via Nazionale, between Piazza Venezia and Termini), is clean, is safe, and a cozy size...all this at a reasonable price. I wonder why I am releasing this secret to all of you? But then I remember that Rome is a city which often betrays tourists, and I want desperately for you to have a wonderful trip there, so here's your little tip. Stay at this hotel. I have stayed at Hotel Italia four times over the past five years, and it's consistently just what you need for simple accommodations in a very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Italia - Great value!”
Reviews.Author: travel_myx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Italia from April 18 through April 28, 2007. When we booked directly with hotel, we asked for Rick Steve's price. This was a double room, inside bath, for 120 euros/night. This included breakfast each morning. Rick Steve's review of the hotel was very accurate. It is very clean, professionally run, and the staff was very friendly on all levels. It is a THREE STAR looking hotel for a TWO star price!! And the added bonus was location, location, location! Thus, our first trip to Rome was very wonderful! We plan to stay there again. In the final analysis, we got more than we expected. One important note-- they do NOT accept CREDIT CARDs for payment on hotel stay. You must purchase EURO Amer. Express Traveler's Checks from your bank. (Not regular Amer. Express Checks) They (hotel) will charge 3 euros on final bill for service fee to cash them in. (not too bad) They also charge 10 euros/day for A/C if you need it. My wife and her sister said they felt very safe there at all times. The staff speaks English and makes it a point to know its clients very quickly. For European standards, this is a good choice for Americans. ** Hey Guys, if you want to impress your ladies, take them to the Maribelle Restaurant at the Five Star hotel, Hotel Splendide Royale!! It is a 7th story terrace restaurant with an awesome view of the city. Expect to spend about 160 to 200 euros per couple. It was worth the experience! Call a taxi from Hotel Italia. Expect to pay about 13 euros (4 persons) to Maribelle.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: proffitt76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in early April as part of a city break. It's about a 15 min walk from Termini Railway Station, you can't get the Metro there but I suppose you could get a bus along the via Nazional but I don't know what number to catch. Hotel is on a quiet side road off Via Nazional. Just a small sign on the wall and reception is on the first floor (there is a small lift). Room wasn't huge but big enough. Bathroom was also a fair size with a good shower. There is a TV but with very poor reception. I also found the walls very thick but the door thin and could hear a bunch of American girls chatting in the corridor very clearly. In reception there is a small bar and a breakfast room. I wasn't overly impressed with the continental breakfast. However....the location is very good. 5-10 Min walk to the nearest Metro station (Republic). You only really need to catch this to the Vatican. Colliseum is a 10 min walk and other things sich as the Trevi fountain are also about a 10-20 min walk. Staff were very friendly and helpful and could speak a variety of languages. The is a bar/cafe underneath that we had breakfast at and was pretty good. If you want an excellent Pizza go to Est Est Est {not the cheesy pizza chain for the british readers!} on Via Genova (out of the hotel onto the street...turn right then right again. At the next crossroads at Via Genova, look left, it's at the end of the road opposite Mr Chows Chinese restaurant.- 2 min walk max) Very good Pizza and wine (1 litre carafe of very good local Frascati for 6 euro)

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: stephan0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in the middle of downtown. The subway, train and bus station is only a 10 minute walk. We spent most of our 3 days walking to the various ruins, and the maps provided at the hotel are adequate, but I bought a bigger/better one at the train station. The staff is very friendly and helpful. There were five of us, and we stayed in the "family room." Rather small with one double bed and 3 singles. The shower was tiny, and if you bumped the door open by accident while soaping up, you'll step out into 1/2 inch of water on the floor. If you take the Rick Steves' rate, you don't get the complimentary breakfast. We paid for it, but it was pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Very ordinary”
Reviews.Author: rajparam
Reviews.Content: Hotel Italia is a quiet, clean place located very close to the Termini station. This location is convenient, and monuments like the Colosseum and Forum are all just 15 minutes walk. But the hotel itself is very ordinary. The room we were in had a shower that had a broken door, and the water wasn't hot enough, especially since temeprature outside was about 10 degrees C. The room itself is very clean, breakfast is very good and included in the price, but I guess for the price I paid of 120 Euros per night, I expected a lot more. I will definitely be looking out for other hotels on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Clean, Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Pennystinker1
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my 2 kids for 4 days last week, we walked to everything and were out until the wee hours, the neighborhood was safe and we easily walked from the train station. The breakfast was lovely and varied - cold pizza available one morning too one - MY personal favorite. The staff were very pleasant, helpful and spoke flawless English (much better than my Italian!). The rooms were spotless, among the cleanest I've stayed in. The front desk is open all night and you leave your key when you go out. There is a sharing bookshelf which was helpful. The price was very reasonable for us $110 euro for a triple including breakfast, cash. This enabled us to actually afford Rome! The shower, while small had good pressure and nice HOT water (sometimes hard to find!) All in all, I would return in a minute!

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel - Especially for the location”
Reviews.Author: hbille
Reviews.Content: The first thing I must stay is ask if they have you staying in the room out in the courtyard. If you are, be prepared. The room itself is clean. Though it is incredibly small. And I was travelling alone, I arrived at night and they took me through a labrynth of corridors to the outside and there was ONE room out there - mine. Needless to say it was a little scary my first night in Italy, arriving in the middle of the night to then get this room. I didn't even know if there were other people there. but in the morning at breakfast, I was pleased to discover it was indeed a real hotel and there were other guests. I stayed there again on my last night in Italy and had a much more comfortable room in the interior of the hotel. While I wouldn't say avoid the other room, just be prepared, it isn't as nice as staying in the other rooms they have. The hotel was clean. the staff was reasonably friendly (but nothing like the hotel David in Florence - they are awesome there!!). The location was fantastic. And the price was right. I'd stay here again if on another brief visit.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Italia was great, nice location and good service.”
Reviews.Author: RobertZanzerkia
Reviews.Content: Stay: Nov23-25 We are family of 5 (3 kids age 8,11,15). We stayed at Hotel Italia for 3 nights and loved it. Of course it's not a 5* hotel but it's simple and clean with a very good location. Right next to Via Nazionale (on Via Venezia). There is a bus stop on the main street (Hotel sells 1E tickets good for 75 minute ride). Hotel provided very good free breakfast. The room was large enough for 5 of us (they provided extra beds). The bathroom was nice and clean but somewhat small. For the price (under Euro 150/night) with the convineant location this is great for families. The front-desk was very helpful with our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, some nice staff, some problems.”
Reviews.Author: brave1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Italia Oct 2nd to 5th after booking directly. I had no problems with reservations, and emails were responded to promptly. After arriving, everything was ok except this was the only hotel I found in Europe who charges 10 Euro a day for a babycot. Every other hotel I stayed in provided babycots free of charge. Air conditioning is 8 Euro extra per day. The Quad room is miniscule, and unless you are thin, you probably wont fit into the toilet. The double rooms are better. The hotel is spotlessly clean and provides free internet on a laptop at the reception. There are plenty of eating places all around and an exceptional bakery just across the street. Just a tip, do NOT stay at the annexe building, (Italia 2) they call it. Getting in is a problem as its attached to another apartment building and you have to ring another hotel's buzzer to let you in unless the hotel provides you with a key. The other hotel doesn't like it. Also note, you have to pay 10 cents to use the elavator everytime in the annexe building and the hotel rooms are on the third floor. The rooms in the annexe are also smaller in my opinion. Have to mention that all the staff except the Manager are very nice and helpful, special mention to Gabriel, Nadine, Sabrina. If you have a problem, you are better off talking to any of the other staff except the manager. The Manager, Mr. Andreas, was always curt and almost rude. Overall, I would stay in the hotel again if I run out of other options, and I cant afford anything better.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Place”
Reviews.Author: eview
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we have been to Italy and we loved it. Found the hotel fairly easily it is not on the ground floor so not easy to spot, it is down a quiet side street so perfect for us. The staff are all really friendly and showed us to our lovely room. we were in room 12 over looking the front of the hotel and even at night with the windows open it wasnt that noisy. It was a big room with a wardobe and dresser, the bathroom was lovely and clean with a shower and fresh towels and a hairdryer. and just outside our room was an ice machine, not bad!! breakfast was served from 7am so if you want to eat early get there on the dot as there were about 7 tables and all filled really quickly. A lovely lady gets your tea or coffee and you help yourself to croissants, pastries, dried toast, cornflakes, fruit salad or yoghurt and juice. For what we paid thought this was fine. The hotel is near all the sights, trevi, spanish steps, forum, colleseum and the vatican is a bit further afield. We went for 4 days and visited most things and we always walked so take sensible shoes as the cobbles really make your feet ache. The colleseum has a joint ticket with the palintino but get to the colleseum early as it gets pretty busy. Try and buy all your food bits from the shop rather than the sellers as it costs a bomb. Watch out for the sales men selling anything from roses to umbrellas depending on the weather. Loads of restaurants, brushetta about 4 euros 1st course pasta approx 7 euro. Use the loos when you see them as there arent many!! also take an empty water bottle as there are plenty of fountains to fill them up. Also when crossing the roads be brave they wont stop at zebra crossings they just dodge you just march out purposely and you will be fine. All in all a brilliant place and brilliant base to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Booking Scam”
Reviews.Author: LnlyPlnt
Reviews.Content: Booked our room with this hotel 2 months in advance. Then one week before arriving we were informed there was 'a problem with our room,' but oh so conveniently 'there is a availability with a hotel we work in partnership with.' The other hotel they've suggested shows up on absolutely no review sites and is almost like it doesn't really exist. I must have called the hotel 3 times to confirm the room was really available on the said date, and I was hugely inconvenienced to have to find another hotel so close to said date. I'd be careful of booking with any hotel that uses these kind of practices.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we expected”
Reviews.Author: kawaguy
Reviews.Content: We broke the house record with our 11-night stay. This hotel is almost exactly as described here, and we were quite satisfied. Our room was a little cosy, probably because of the North American demand for an ensuite bathroom. Quiet. Good bed. Bathroom satisfactory if a little cosy (shower only), and very clean. We paid 8 Euro a night extra for air conditioning, and it was worth every penny. By the third night we had figured out how to get the settings we wanted instead of the default. Breakfast was fine, including good coffee or cappuccino and quality pastries. Served in a pleasant room. Free Internet access in the lobby; we used it daily. The location is good - some good sights and shopping nearby, lots of bus stops, a grocery store 50 yards away, and a Metro station an easy walk away. The hotel desk staff all speak English fluently, and were very helpful. All had different personalities and useful advice. We got the Rick Steves price. It was very good value for money. You might not like it if you need more space or a chair in your room, but if you'll give up space for money, it's just fine. There were several groups of four; I didn't ask if they have larger rooms or these people booked two rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, gracious staff”
Reviews.Author: basiap
Reviews.Content: We were guests at Hotel Italia from June 24-28. Our group consisted of 16 people: our family of 5, my husband's parents, his siblings and their families. We had a total of 6 rooms which were adequate in size for the time we spent in them, but more importantly they were clean with recently renovated bathrooms. The temperature in Rome was in the 90’s during our stay so we did request air conditioning for an additional €8 per day – well worth it! Sabrina, Nadine and Gabriel at the front desk were delightful - extremely helpful and knowledgeable. We all found breakfast adequate to get us started each morning: a nice selection of pastries; breads and rolls with assorted pre-packaged pâtés and cheeses; cereal, yogurt, fruit cocktail. Beverage choices included juice, milk, tea, coffee and wonderful cappuccino. We found the location to be ideal. We were able to walk to many of the major sites and monuments, including the Colosseum & Forum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Santa Maria Maggiore, St. Peter in Chains, (I mapped the walking distances at Michelin.com prior to our trip and the range is from ½ mile to 1½ miles). Busses run frequently along Via Nazionale and there is a metro stop close by which was perfect for getting to St. Peter’s Square, the Vatican Museums and The Spanish Steps. Termini station is easily within walking distance. As far as nearby restaurants, we enjoyed having cocktails several times at Il Pomo D’Oro, right next door to the hotel. My in-laws raved about the lunch they had at Trattoria Pizzeria Al Venezia, directly across the street. We all enjoyed dinner at Al Barocco Ristorante, two blocks away. Our first night we asked the staff to make a recommendation for us which was Al Boschetto. We were given a coupon for free beverages which turned out to be nothing more than an overly-sweet aperitif. The food was fine, but the staff was not as gracious as we found in other restaurants – perhaps they found our group of 16 overwhelming. There is also a Despar grocery store at the end of the block which was great for having a snacks and beverages in our rooms. If you are looking for a family-friendly hotel with a helpful staff, clean rooms and convenient location, definitely consider Hotel Italia.

Reviews.Title: “perfecto, just add air”
Reviews.Author: dd10082005
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for the price. It is a short walk from the train station but still in a beautiful part of town. the Via Nazionale has great shopping along it, i wish we had more time but we had worn outselves out sightseeing. If you are young and fit you can totally walk everywhere from this hotel, we even walked to and fro Vatican City from here. The breakfast is great with quaint breakfast room. The only unexpected thing was that AC was extra 8 EU per night. Luckily it had cooled some and our room was shaded with a killer ceiling fan, so we didn't need it even with the heat wave that seemed to follow us through Italy. The room was small and plain but overall a great package for the money. would stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Helpful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: GARZA1
Reviews.Content: We satyed at Hotel Italia 3 nights the first week of June. Just one word of warning, make sure you ask for a room as far away as possible from the breakfast room/evening it turns into a bar. The first night we had room #4(one room away from the bar)- we were awakened at midnight by GREAT Laughter!!!! finally after about 30 minutes of loud conversation. I got up and complained. The evening clerk was entertaining some friends in the bar! I am so glad I complained because the next day they moved our room to the back of the hotel - it was perfect. The rooms were clean and the breakfast was nice (for Europe). Cearal, very sweet yorgurt & crossiants. Make sure you get there early for breakfast because the good pastries are the first to go! We only saw pizza one morning but it went very fast and they didn't replenish.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, Good location”
Reviews.Author: antoniogambadoro
Reviews.Content: Good deal, you pay a 2* hotel rate but you get an average 3* ! Hotel Italia was good, the room was small but clean and functional. Great location, public transportation tickets and passes available at the reception, maps, etc. Typical Italian Breakfast (coffee and croissants), so no ham or cheese :-(

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Italia is great”
Reviews.Author: stdonatus
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Italia from April 26-May 2. I was very pleased with the hotel. The room was small by American hotel standards, but very clean. Hotel staff was very friendly and spoke excellent English. Hotel was located 1/2 block from Via Nazionale, a main street with many buses, and it was about 8-9 minute walk from the Repubblica subway station. It was a little too far to walk to Termini train station with a suitcase, but by cab, Termini was only about 8-9 minutes away. Hotel has a laptop computer for guests to check e-mail or the Internet. I would recommend Hotel Italia. Warning about gypsies in Termini -- they are there, so watch your purse. I was approached by 3 gypsies in 10 minutes while using the self service ticket machine in Termini.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Italia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at Hotel Italia in April 2006.Great hotel!!Special thanks to Gabriel for all the tips!!

Reviews.Title: “H otel Italia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent for a 2 star hotel. The room was freshly painted and clean, and the customer service was exceptional. They held our luggage for a week while we travelled in the South, and were helpful in securing reservations at museums. The location is also a big plus - within walking distance of many important attractions and the Termini. Each and every desk clerk (Sergio, Nadine, Andrea, Sabrina, Gabriel) throughout our stay was helpful and friendly. We highly recommend Hotel Italia.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Boffeline
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times. It is fairly cheap, and the standard is nothing extravagant but the rooms are clean, bath is fairly new, staff is friendly and the breakfast is actually not that bad either. It is fairly central, and you have short walking distance to all the attractions. I would highly recommend this hotel if you are looking for a good value hotel in Rome, which will give you money left to spend on other things in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet Location at a Great price”
Reviews.Author: rjonuws
Reviews.Content: Hotel Italia is a very quiet simple hotel within a 10 minute walk to Termini Train station. The common areas of the hotel are nothing to write home about, but the room was spacious (for Rome standards), and VERY clean, with nice hard wood floors. Breakfast is so-so. But for price, location and room quality, you cannot go wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Wise choice!”
Reviews.Author: vladimirzunz
Reviews.Content: Very friendly, high standard and good value. Staff are helpful and pleasent and the price is very low compared to what you get. People have complained about room size, but our double room was spacious, clean, modern and tasteful. Totally decent location; nothing better in this price category. Staff happily arranged flowers for the room when my girlfriend had her birthday, although it was a hassle for them on sunday, and charged next to nothing for the service. Slight cons are that our room was in a different building to the reception, and wasn't as soundproof as it could have been (room to room wise that is; there was absolutely no street noise.)

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Italia for three nights in September 2005, with 3 friends, and I would certainly recommend it. The triple room looked more like it was a double room with a third small settee bed crammed into it; but the room was clean and tidy; the bathroom (with hair dryer and bidet), excellent; and the staff were most helpful. The free breakfast provided may initially be meant to be a light one, consisting of croissants, cereals, pizza(!), etc.; but as it was served in the manner of a buffet, my friends and I would just go back for seconds (or thirds!) until we were full. The location is very convenient to the main train station, and the hotel can assist you with airport transfers. Will confirm that there is an EXCELLENT pizzeria nearby. When in Rome, bring a cagoule to be ready for sudden torrential downpours, bring an umbrella to sheild you from the sun/heat while in the queue for the Vatican, and try and attach your wallet to your trousers with a chain in case you come across any pickpockets (it's no joke, they really are everywhere). In saying this, was surprised how much I missed Rome, and would certainly go again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent lodging at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If the reviews conserning the size of the rooms are in fact true, then we had the best and biggest room in the whole hotel! Double room with plenty of space to move around plus a good size shower easily fitting two people. The room was at the annex across the street which is a much better kept building. The keys no longer need to be returned to the main desk when you leave so you save a trip up one floor. If you're looking for a hotel with a lobby, this one doesn't have one. What it does have is a front desk with very helpful in every way people, a small breakfast area with 7 tables and an adequate breakfast selection (don't expect super variety), very clean and (in our case at least) comfortable rooms and daily bed and linen changing service with fluffy towels. We made sure our reservation was confirmed several times and made a request for a double bed also several times. If you're looking for the hotel experience you won't find it here. For a place to stay while you walk all over Rome, it's perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AccommodationQueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Italia in Feb 2005, and considered it more a 3 star hotel than a 2 star (in comparison to some other 3 star hotels we have experienced). The hotel was a good, central location, within walking distance of the major sights (we found it very easy to walk everywhere). Very comfortable and clean rooms for a 2 star hotel. We found the staff to be very helpful, and we enjoyed the included fresh and tasty breakfast. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Points and Bad points”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Nov 2005 and whilst being very clean, the rooms are very small. The location was Great! Breakfast was limited I felt. But the worst part was the noise: We were in Room 46 - the room closest to reception. We were woken everyday by people setting up for breakfast, and then by people having breakfast - the noise was horrendous and it was impossible to sleep. The walls ARE paper thin. All in all it was fine for the price, but there are improvements to be made!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel italia in 2004 july. It is a good hotel for people who are looking for low budget, I paid around 70 euros per night. The hotel is clean and staffs are friendly, breakfast is ok as well. Yet, I will suggest to stay away from getting a single room if possible because single rooms are all facing the backyard corridor which is quite terrible, but double rooms are fine facing the street which is quite nice.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest Room I've Seen In Europe”
Reviews.Author: Ibanker
Reviews.Content: Hotel Italia is almost acceptable. Our room was clean, sanitary and the breakfast was fine. However, when you open the door to your hotel room and it is blocked by the bed, there is a problem. The room was unreasonably small. For two people and luggage, it was a difficult, if not unbearable fit. Only if the Italia represented itself as a hostel and charged half as much money, would I would have been happy with such accomadations. Although the staff was friendly and the location was convenient, there was also a noise problem. The walls were paper-thin and I could barely sleep past 7 AM because of the noise. I would not recomment staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights (Sept 9-Sept 12). Hotel Italia is in a great location off Via Nationale, a street with lots of shops. We could walk everywhere, including to the Termini train station, the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Forum, Pantheon, etc.. the only time we took the subway was when we visited the Vatican. The room was very clean and the washroom was modern. It was a small room, but adequate - nothing fancy or exciting, but it is a 2 star hotel and it was not expensive (110 euro/night). We loved the ceiling fan.. after a hot day walking through the city, it was so refreshing. If you want air conditioning, it's 8 euros a day (well worth it in summer months). There is 24h a day free internet access in the lobby and the staff are very friendly and helpful! They mailed our postcards for us too. Colour TV with CNN, MTV Italy, and Italian stations in the rooms. An earlier reviewer had complained about the breakfast. Considering it's just a 2 star hotel, we found the breakfast to be very good! Fruit yogurt, croissants, bread, melba toast, donuts, cereal, fruit drink, canned fruit cocktail, cream cheese spread, jam, honey, cold pizza, etc. And it was FREE and unlimited. To compare with other 2 star hotels.. at the Suez in Paris, we had to pay 5 euros a day for breakfast, and you only got 1 croissant, 1 roll, and coffee.. that was it! So the Italia breakfast was great for a 2 star. We were very satisfied with this hotel and would stay here again. If you want a 4 star Hilton don't stay here.. but if you want an above average 2 star, it's great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: rhlinva
Reviews.Content: I do see bad reviews of this hotel, so I will review my stay. My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights in October on our honeymoon. The hotel was very easy to book with from their website. They are about a 15 minute walk from Termini, which wasn't too terrible, even in a light mist. It seemed farther because we were trying to find our way, and the streets were definitely crowded. Once you find the hotel on Via Venezia, you might have to be buzzed in the front door, depending on when you arrive. The hotel is the last door on the right. You can take the lift, or walk 1.5 flights up to the lobby. The front desk staff was more than helpful. We had room 12, which was great! It was very spacious, and had a nice window to look out onto the alley. The windows were nice and thick, so no noise! The bathroom was a good size, and it had a big shower. The breakfast was great, with pastries, cereal, juice, PIZZA and great coffee. They had a laptop w/ internet you could use in the lobby. The location was very good, with only a 15 minute walk to the colosseum/forum. We did walk to the Vatican, but took the bus back. We paid 120 euro per night, and would definitely stay here again. The hotel has an airport shuttle service, and we paid 50 euro for a ride to the airport. It was defintely worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff at Italia”
Reviews.Author: newcreations
Reviews.Content: Hotel Italia was centrally located to transportation and sights in Rome just off the Via Nationale. The metro was only 3 blocks away at Piazza Republica and bus stop was less than one block away. Management was very helpful with regards to information on restaurants, tourist info and maps. A filling breakfast buffet greeted us each morning. The rooms were clean, and bath was adequate. We enjoyed our three day stay. The only negative was that last minute cancellations are not honored. We stayed there Aug. 26-29 2005

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I stayed in the Hotel Italia for three nights. This hotel proved value for money it is in a good location ideal for walking to most of the sights (apart from the vatican which can easily be accessed by Metro). The room and bathroom were extremely clean, the breakfast adequate and the staff helpful. We stayed in the annexe across the raod from the main reception and the room was quiet. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ktyldy
Reviews.Content: Fairly good location, walking distance (about 15 minutes) to the Colosseum, Roma Termini, and public transportation options. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly. Breakfast was good, and included which is ALWAYS a plus! The air-conditioning was extra (8 Euros) but well worth it in July. The only problem we experienced was that the parking that was advertised as 200 meters away was a bit farther! There were four of us and a lot of luggage, so a parking spot closer would have been nice. Other than that we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the Hotel Italia. Our first visit was during March 2005. The highlight of this hotel is the location. It is a 10 minute walk from the Termini Bus and Railway Station and is within walking distance of all other tourist attractions in the centre of Rome. It is not the easiest hotel to find, tucked away on Via Venezia, just off the Via Nazionale, so our first visit was via a taxi ride from the Termini. The hotel is on the second floor of the building, so entrance is via a communal front door. The first time we stayed our room was very small and had no natural light. It was also extremely noisy during the nights because it was situated next to the communal toilet / shower room which was in constant use all night. However during our second visit we were extremely pleased to find that our room was far bigger with a large double bed, two windows and air conditioning. The rooms / bathrooms are basic, but very clean. The staff are extremely helpful and the breakfast is a tasty continental selection. I would definitely recommend this hotel because of its convenient location and value for money. You get what you pay for: a basic holiday with basic rates. However, the bonus is definitely its location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamilyS4
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a family room with our 2 teenage daughters and were all very pleased with the room and breakfast. Staff were very helpful and approachable. Location is ideal for all the main sites ,using bus or on foot. Being Rome, we were expecting a noisy stay but even though it is just off the Via Nazionale, it was very quiet. Would certainly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Viva Italia!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
