Reviews.Content: We are a young Canadian couple touring Italy for the first time and Hotel Italia gave us a great start to our vacation! The quiet location is sweet since it gives easy access to the trains, subways and buses, but it is also within walking distance of the Fontana di Trevi, Piazza del Popollo, Spanish Steps and plenty of other great sights. We stayed here based on other reviews and we were not disappointed! The staff was very friendly and our room and bathroom were so clean you could practically eat your adequate breakfast buffet and great coffee off the hard wood floors. The furniture was basic, the double bed was 2 single beds pushed together, but we quickly came to realize that in every hotel we stayed at in Italy, 1+1=2. As for the size of the room and bathroom, they are definately smaller than North American standards, but honestly folks: 1) For 90 Euro per night, don't expect that you'll need a golf cart to get from the bathroom to the bed 2) How big are the rooms the average cruise ship? 3) In all the Italian hotels we stayed at, the norm for the rooms was SMALL BUT CLEAN. Now ask yourself: Would you rather have a clean small room or a big dirty one? In summary, Hotel Italia advertises itself as a 2 star hotel which is exactly what it is. For the price, location, great staff and cleanliness, it is tough to beat. Stay here. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the Annex next door!”
Reviews.Author: cnc
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in mid June for 2 nights in the Annex and 1 night a week later in the hotel itself. We had been traveling for 30 hours and expected a warm welcome. The night staff person gave us less than that. It was our first time in Europe and didn't know about the lifts and the non discript entrances to hotels. He treated us like the "problem children." There was a minimal greeting then we were told we were staying across the street in the Annex. The room was ok, clean, but for our first time in Europe not what we'd hoped for. The next morning there was a much nicer person (Andrea) at the desk. Having internet access was nice. The buffet breakfast was a good thing to have to start off the day. Although, our second morning there there wasn't any room to sit down, so we went in search of our own breakfast. We should've stayed there to wait, as it was hard to find something nearby. The location of the hotel is good and there is a really good pizza place around the corner (Ricci). There is also a yummy bakery (they don't serve coffee though)on the same street as the hotel. The last night we stayed there, our room was in the hotel. It was nicer and felt like we were more included in the hotel. The woman (Nadine) at the desk that evening was very friendly. We would stay there again, but would request a room in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not a hotel that I will return”
Reviews.Author: ycheng8
Reviews.Content: This hotel got to be the smallest room we have ever stayed. The double room does not have enough space to put your luggage down let alone walk around the room. Bathroom is super small too. Most of the receptionist is friendly except one is very cold. I don't know how others rate this hotel so high. I will never stay here. I think it is over-priced for they can offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: yashi&ono
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for a total of 5 nights in early May. We stayed in the annex for the first 4 nights, and then we had to change rooms on the last night. The room in the annex was clean, but really small... not enough space to fully open-up our luggages. But the room that we stayed in on the last night was great --lots of space, good air-conditioning, and quiet. We don't know why we had to change rooms, though. The staff members at the hotel were very friendly, and buffet breakfast was good (see attached photo). The location is good too. You could walk to/from the Termini station (about 10-15 min), and the Metro Repubblica station is even closer (about 5 min).

Reviews.Title: “great place!”
Reviews.Author: travelustej
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Hotel Italia. It was very comfortable, breakfast was excellent, service was friendly and the rooms were quite clean. We thought it was an excellent value for our central location. We stayed in the annex accross the street and it really felt as if we had our own little apartment in Rome for a few days. The area was quiet enough and seemed safe. It is not a fancy place but certainly met and actually exceeded our expectations. The only small annoyance for us was that we were not able to use our calling card from our room and had to travel to the front desk to do so. However, that may have only been becasue we were staying in the annex. The staff was nonetheless very accomadating about it. I would definetley return to the Hotel Italia!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: paletexan
Reviews.Content: Hotel Italia is a comfortable hotel in the heart of the city. Each room is slightly different adding to that old world charm. The bathroom in our particular room was renovated recently, and the living space was clean without many frills. PROS: - Central location for many sights and proximity to metro. - Continental breakfast was included. - Staff was helpful. - Good value. - Free Internet access available. CONS: - Hotel furniture is a little more modest than we're used to in the US.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, close enough to walk to everything”
Reviews.Author: jmurphyjohnson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a great location and price for staying close to all the attractions Rome has to offer. We have traveled to Rome several times now, and it was the first time to stay in this area and at this property. You can walk to the train station, get to Ancient Rome by foot, the Spanish Steps, and the Trevi Fountain all without having to use a cab. The rooms were clean and quiet, and the breakfast was great. I would stay here again, and thought it was a tremendous value for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Worked for us”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Realizing that Hotel Italia gets guidebook ratings under budget class (though such a thing does not truly exist in historic Rome during high season) and that it's a two-star operation, we were perfectly happy with the facility. It's an 11-minute walk from the airport express at the train station, and about 20 minutes walking to other key locations (Coliseum, Borghese, Spanish Steps). The room has enough space to move around in, which is nice over a several day period. Access to air conditioning is helpful, and the street is relatively quiet at night. Water pressure and heat in the shower is good, but space might be difficult for a wide person. Staff is friendly and helpful (good about delivering phone messages, made Borghese reservations for us), and maid service is thorough. We'd go back (and Est! Est! Est! Pizza is a half block away; so is a travel agent that can print train tickets and save time versus the station). Breakfast is limited (yogurt, cereal, pastries) but adequate.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Hotel Italia!”
Reviews.Author: gopatriots
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Italy and Hotel Italia was our 1st stop. We stay 4 nights in the annex and although the room and bathroom were small, everything was spotless. We overlooked a small park. The rooms were on the 3rd floor quiet except for the occasional entrance buzzer. It has a lift. This hotel is minutes from the teminal. Literally, a couple of blocks. A very safe neighborhood. We walked everywhere. The Vatican took about 30 minutes to walk to. Everything else was 20 minutes or less. We loved the breakfast. The breakfast room was very pretty and the food was great. I was happy to meet Andreas. He is very sweet and helpful. Overall, I would stay here again. Great place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient hotel.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Hotel Italia. We had to switch rooms the last night because I added the 3rd night later, after booking for only 2 nights (we never did fully understand this, but it was no big deal, they moved our luggage for us to the new room). The first 2 nights we stayed in the annex across the street. The room was tiny, but clean. The bathroom was also tiny, but the shower had great water pressure and hot water. Our room the last night was much bigger, so I would recommend checking which part of the hotel you are in. We also only got CNN in the main hotel, not the annex. Breakfast was pretty standard, but good - croissants, cereal, yogurt and bread. The staff all spoke English and were very helpful. They have a computer available with internet access and setup a taxi to the airport for us (50 Euro for 4 people). The location was good although a bit removed from the more lively areas. We walked everywhere. I was concerned about being close to the train station, but it is not that close. Overall, a very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: clarnicheallaigh
Reviews.Content: Myself and my sister stayed in Hotel Italia from 3-7March 2005 and found it to be exactly what we were hoping for. We had been told not to expect too much from accommodation in Rome, that it is fairly basic when you are only staying in a 2/3 star hotel. This 2star star hotel however was great, in that the staff were extremely friendly and spoke english perfectly. We had a great breakfast every morning that consisted of cereal, croissants, tea/coffee, brown bread and fruit salad (what more could one ask for). Our twin room was very clean with fresh towels every morning and the shower was really spacious. We also had air conditioning/heating system, along with a safety deposit box built into the wall in our room, which i think is ideal for tourists. The hotel is walking distance from the main attractions and has a trattoria, a ristorante and a faboulas little bakery at its doorstep. I would definately recommend anyone to stay in Hotel Italia. It is perfect for couples, individual travellers, business people etc. It gets full marks on my list for a two star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: KatherineNZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February 2005 and it was great. The room was small and it was noisy because we were right next to the breakfast room/bar, but it was clean and comfortable and the staff were very helpful. The breakfasts were good. Great location, close to everything and we felt completely safe in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: khw225
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2005. Nice little hotel close to Termini (but not too close) and about 10-15 minutes walking distance from most tourist attractions. The rooms were small (but not the smallest I've seen in Italy), but absolutely squeaky clean! Small but decent breakfast. Not much street noise. Unfortunately, we developed an allergy problem during the trip, and we're unsure whether it was related to the hotel. However, the staff was helpful and let us switch rooms and even got us linens from another hotel, just in case. Sadly, the 2nd room had a poor shower. But overall we found this to be a good, inexpensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good location, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying 5 nights in Hotel Italia. We read previous reviews before booking the place. Well, yes, our room was indeed small and I was forever hopping over my boyfriend's luggage to get to the bathroom. On the first night, we also had those strange tea towels that previous reviews mentioned but they were replaced by normal fluffy towels for subsequent nights.. The location is good, we basically walked all over the place from the hotel - the Colosseum, Piazza Navona, Jewish Ghetto, Trevi Fountain etc. VERY CLEAN room. I liked the breakfast, developed a sudden liking for scone with nutella. For people who expect a full cooked breakfast (sausages, eggs etc), you'll probably be better off visiting England.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent little hotel just of Via Nazionale in Via Venezia. Ten minutes walk from Termini station or five minutes from the Republica metro. Lift up to reception for those heavy bags. Staff were very helpfull, room was just right, clean and comfortable with air con, phone, cable t.v (but only one in English CNN). No coffee making in the room but reception makes excellent coffee anyway. It's close by some very nice shops on Via Nazionale and all the main sites are within easy walking distance. Great Tratoria opposite the hotel and a top pizzaria (turn right out of the hotel turn right down the street left again at the first junction to Est Est Est). Don't expect a full English breakfast, it's bread, coissants, jam and cornflakes. I would recommend this hotel and at 210 Euro for the three nights for two adults it's a bargain. As for Rome, it's as you would expect except for the beggars, the graffiti and the CRAZY drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler4248
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Italia for 12 nights in late November-early December, 2004. This small, family run hotel is well located in a good neighborhood, one block South of Via Nationale and 8-9 blocks from Statione Termini, the main train station. The efficient, friendly, helpful, knowledgeable staff is on duty 24 hours, keeping the hotel very safe. They speak fluent English and are as helpful as a concierge in a bigger hotel. The large, varied breakfast is a great way to start the day. The rooms are kept very clean by a friendly, attentive staff. The double pane windows are essential in keeping Rome's ever present noise at bay, even on small streets. This hotel is a great find in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Italia was great!”
Reviews.Author: Jewel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Rome and Hotel Italia was an excellent choice in accomodations! The staff spoke English and were very helpful! The rooms were lovely and spacious and CLEAN! The location was ideal and within walking distance of the Termini Station and many Center City sites. The complementary breakfast was delicious with as many cups of coffee as was desired! All this at a reasonable price made us want to come back for more.

Reviews.Title: “STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: kilmistr
Reviews.Content: A great hotel. The hotel is about a 15 minutes walk from the main train station. The staff were very nice, always welcomed us with a smile. They sell bus/ metro tickets, stamps, and have a high speed internet laptop available for guests. They have alot of tourist info as well. There is a book case with books, many in english, you can take to your room and read. The breakfast is good and filling. The rooms are small, and so is the bathroom, but very clean. There is a bus stop outside the hotel where you can catch the main buses to see the city. The walk to the spanish steps is about 10-15 minutes. The only bad thing I have to say about the hotel is that the towels are rather thin. Other than that I have nothing else bad to say about this hotel. Would stay here again. When you reach the hotel go thru the door under the hotel sign (if it is locked, buzz the hotel receptionist) and enter the last door on the right. There is an elevator or you can take the stairs to reception.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: jlechem
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel in september of 2004 for 3 nights. We were in a double room with AC for roughly 113 euros a night. The room was large with lots of closets and space. The bed was comfy and the entire room was very clean. We also had hardwood floors which was kind of nice. However I am a large man at 6'4 and the shower was so small I could barely fit in it. I had to squeeze to get into it. The shared shower room seemed to be a bit larger but being a squeemish American I went with in suite. The location I found to be very convienant. The hotel is on a side street of one of the main streets in rome( nationale?) and we ran into no noise problems even with the windows open. You are within walking distance of the coloseum, roman forums, and a few other scenic sites. However take a taxi or ride the subway to the vatican. It's only a few minutes walk to the closest subway stop Republicca. I found this to be irritating but only after a long day of walking and sightseeing. The staff were very curteous and friendly and always had good advice on good places to eat and how to get around town. The breakfast buffet was good but not the greatest I've ever had. And I highly reccomend the little pizza shop across the street. We ate there several times and had wonderful meals!

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at Hotel Italia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Italia last year for 6 nights and thought it was a good value for the money. It is clean. The staff is competent and friendly. They have great suggestions for restaurants, sights, and the best way to get around the city. My room was small but that's what I paid for; everything worked well and it had just had some modern updates. The location is outstanding. They serve a small and limited continental breakfast for those interested in that sort of thing. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value in Rome”
Reviews.Author: TR45
Reviews.Content: This is a nice and very clean hotel. The rooms are clean and the baths, while small (with very small showers) were spotless. The staff is extremely courteous. The breakfast is a modest buffet style that was not the best I have had in Europe, although it was certainly not the worst and provided a decent start to the day. My only complaint is that the doors to the rooms are paper thin and noise transmits through them very easily so you cannot be a later riser (I am not). The walls were thick as brick and the small street has no scooter traffic (or any traffic), and thus is quite quiet. It is a reasonable walk to the Colosseum, the Victor Emanuel monument, etc. but is about a half hour walk to the Vatican (and I walk fairly fast). The Termini station is quite convenient on foot as well. I recommend this hotel overall and it is a very good value in a city where hotels can cost far more.

Reviews.Title: “Best of All”
Reviews.Author: jeantb
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in practically all european countries many times, + USA: Hotel Italia was by far the best Hotel, for cleanliness, Central location Accommodation, & facilities such as a small library and the use of internet - nice to have a hotel with a elevator: it was certainly the Best Breakfast of any Hotel we have stayed in: so efficient, an absolute joy to eat the fresh bread rolls, pastries, and the huge selection of teas and coffee's: Pastry and Bread baskets were kept full all the time, also a selection of cereal, juice and yogurt and even pizza: everywhere was spotless. Beautiful italian towels in Bathroom - wonderful for drying, plenty of hot water and Rooms left sparkling every day. Oh, and the price is unbeatable: 80 euros per double room, the breakfast alone is easily worth 10 euros each. Cannot be beaten on Location, Price, Accommodation, and Cleanliness. Thanks to all the helpful staff, All very welcoming and friendly, and will do anything to help, without being too pushy.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Disappointing. Our room (double for 113 Euros) was dreary and noisy, even in the annex which is supposed to be a little nicer. Towels are paper thin. Cancellation policy is atrocious (lose 1 night payment if cancel within 10 days and lose the full stay if cancel within 5 days) and they don't tell you about it until after they have your confirmation with credit card info. This policy was not listed on the website either. We stayed at 2 other hotels in Rome in a similar price range during this trip and Hotel Italia was definitely at the bottom of the heap in terms of noise, quality of room, and reservation flexibility. I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: FrozenNorske
Reviews.Content: I booked a single room 75 euro and found it to be a great value. Location was very good, right off via nazionale, close to metro station Republicca. I walked or used the metro to get to all tourist sites. It was noisy but so is Rome, bring a cd player and a headset or earplugs if you are a light sleeper. The staff was very courteous and spoke english. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good for price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean, the staff helpful. The location is OK, but a little far from our interest. Others have mentioned the bathrooms (yes, they are small), the towels (yes, they are thin, but do dry you) and loud. I would reconsider this hotel in the summer if outside noise makes sleep hard for you. The room was great with the window open, but it was loud too.
